뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 근데 = but (casual spoken contraction of 그런데)
그런데 = but / however (standard, spoken and written)
허나 = however / but (literary/archaic, very formal writing or historical narration). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
엄청 = super / extremely (colloquial emphasis — casual speech)
매우 = very (standard formal intensifier)
지극히 = exceedingly / supremely (literary, the utmost degree — formal writing)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 엄청 맛있다! / 매우 중요한 사안입니다. / 지극히 개인적인 의견입니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's super delicious! / This is a very important matter. / This is an exceedingly personal opinion.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 엄청 = super / extremely (colloquial emphasis — casual speech)
매우 = very (standard formal intensifier)
지극히 = exceedingly / supremely (literary, the utmost degree — formal writing). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
진짜 = really / for real (casual, emphatic — slang-adjacent)
정말 = really / truly (standard, neutral emphasis)
실로 = truly / indeed (literary/formal — expressing genuine awe or emphasis in writing)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 진짜야? 진짜로? / 정말 감사합니다. / 실로 놀라운 성과이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Really? For real? / I truly thank you. / It is indeed a remarkable achievement.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 진짜 = really / for real (casual, emphatic — slang-adjacent)
정말 = really / truly (standard, neutral emphasis)
실로 = truly / indeed (literary/formal — expressing genuine awe or emphasis in writing). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
게다가 = on top of that / besides (casual, spoken addition — piling on)
더욱이 = moreover / furthermore (formal written, escalating importance)
나아가 = furthermore / going further (formal, advancing the argument to a next step)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 비도 오고 게다가 바람도 분다. / 더욱이 이번 사건은 전례가 없다. / 나아가 제도적 개선이 필요하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's raining and on top of that, it's windy. / Moreover, this incident is unprecedented. / Furthermore, institutional improvements are needed.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 게다가 = on top of that / besides (casual, spoken addition — piling on)
더욱이 = moreover / furthermore (formal written, escalating importance)
나아가 = furthermore / going further (formal, advancing the argument to a next step). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그냥 = just / for no reason (casual, vague — 'just because', 'without doing anything special')
단순히 = simply / merely (formal, clarifying that something is uncomplicated or limited in scope)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그냥 왔어. / 이것은 단순히 실수가 아니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I just came (no particular reason). / This is not simply a mistake.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 그냥 and 단순히: 그냥 = just / for no reason (casual, vague — 'just because', 'without doing anything special')
단순히 = simply / merely (formal, clarifying that something is uncomplicated or limited in scope). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아마 = maybe / probably (casual, everyday uncertainty)
십중팔구 = in all likelihood / nine times out of ten (idiomatic, high probability — more emphatic and literary)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아마 내일 올 거야. / 십중팔구 그가 범인일 것이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He'll probably come tomorrow. / In all likelihood, he is the culprit.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 아마 and 십중팔구: 아마 = maybe / probably (casual, everyday uncertainty)
십중팔구 = in all likelihood / nine times out of ten (idiomatic, high probability — more emphatic and literary). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
왜냐하면 = because / the reason is (spoken, explaining cause in conversation)
~(이)기에 = because / since (formal written, giving reason in condensed literary form)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 왜냐하면 시간이 없었으니까. / 부족하기에 더 노력해야 한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Because I didn't have time. / Because it is lacking, we must try harder.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 왜냐하면 and ~(이)기에: 왜냐하면 = because / the reason is (spoken, explaining cause in conversation)
~(이)기에 = because / since (formal written, giving reason in condensed literary form). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
마치다 = to finish (native Korean, general — wrapping up a task or event)
완료하다 = to complete (Sino-Korean, formal — official completion with finality)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 수업을 마쳤다. / 시스템 업데이트가 완료되었습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Finished the class. / The system update has been completed.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 마치다 and 완료하다: 마치다 = to finish (native Korean, general — wrapping up a task or event)
완료하다 = to complete (Sino-Korean, formal — official completion with finality). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
가르치다 = to teach (native Korean, direct instruction — teacher to student)
교육하다 = to educate (Sino-Korean, systematic — institutions, broader development)
훈련하다 = to train (Sino-Korean, drilling skills — military, sports, specific competencies)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 학생들에게 수학을 가르친다. / 시민 의식을 교육해야 한다. / 신입 사원을 훈련시키다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I teach math to students. / We must educate civic awareness. / Training the new employees.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 가르치다 = to teach (native Korean, direct instruction — teacher to student)
교육하다 = to educate (Sino-Korean, systematic — institutions, broader development)
훈련하다 = to train (Sino-Korean, drilling skills — military, sports, specific competencies). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
모으다 = to gather / collect (native Korean, general — money, people, things)
수집하다 = to collect (Sino-Korean, systematic — data, specimens, stamps, curated collections)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 돈을 모으고 있다. / 우표를 수집하는 취미가 있다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm saving up money. / I have a hobby of collecting stamps.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 모으다 and 수집하다: 모으다 = to gather / collect (native Korean, general — money, people, things)
수집하다 = to collect (Sino-Korean, systematic — data, specimens, stamps, curated collections). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
빌리다 = to borrow / lend (native Korean, casual everyday — from friends, library)
대여하다 = to rent / lease (Sino-Korean, commercial — equipment, books, formal rental)
차용하다 = to borrow (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — loans; also figurative: borrowing concepts or words)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 친구한테 우산을 빌렸다. / 장비를 대여해 드립니다. / 외국어에서 차용한 표현이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I borrowed an umbrella from a friend. / We rent out the equipment. / It's an expression borrowed from a foreign language.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 빌리다 = to borrow / lend (native Korean, casual everyday — from friends, library)
대여하다 = to rent / lease (Sino-Korean, commercial — equipment, books, formal rental)
차용하다 = to borrow (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — loans; also figurative: borrowing concepts or words). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
고르다 = to pick / choose (native Korean, casual — selecting from options by preference)
선택하다 = to select / choose (Sino-Korean, deliberate — making a decision among alternatives)
선별하다 = to screen / sort out (Sino-Korean, filtering — selecting by criteria, quality control)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 마음에 드는 걸로 골라. / 진로를 선택해야 한다. / 우수한 인재를 선별하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Pick whichever you like. / You need to choose a career path. / Screening for outstanding talent.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 고르다 = to pick / choose (native Korean, casual — selecting from options by preference)
선택하다 = to select / choose (Sino-Korean, deliberate — making a decision among alternatives)
선별하다 = to screen / sort out (Sino-Korean, filtering — selecting by criteria, quality control). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
쌓다 = to pile up / build up (native Korean, tangible and figurative — blocks, experience, trust)
축적하다 = to accumulate (Sino-Korean, formal — wealth, knowledge, data over time)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 경험을 쌓아야 한다. / 오랜 기간 기술을 축적해 왔다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: You need to build up experience. / We have accumulated technology over a long period.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 쌓다 and 축적하다: 쌓다 = to pile up / build up (native Korean, tangible and figurative — blocks, experience, trust)
축적하다 = to accumulate (Sino-Korean, formal — wealth, knowledge, data over time). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
치르다 = to pay / undergo (native Korean — pay a price, take an exam, endure hardship; figurative cost)
지불하다 = to pay (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — monetary payment transactions)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 큰 대가를 치렀다. / 카드로 지불하시겠습니까?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Paid a heavy price. / Would you like to pay by card?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 치르다 and 지불하다: 치르다 = to pay / undergo (native Korean — pay a price, take an exam, endure hardship; figurative cost)
지불하다 = to pay (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — monetary payment transactions). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
이기다 = to win / beat (native Korean, casual — games, arguments, opponents)
승리하다 = to achieve victory (Sino-Korean, formal — wars, elections, grand triumphs)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 축구에서 이겼다! / 마침내 전쟁에서 승리했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: We won at soccer! / Finally achieved victory in the war.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 이기다 and 승리하다: 이기다 = to win / beat (native Korean, casual — games, arguments, opponents)
승리하다 = to achieve victory (Sino-Korean, formal — wars, elections, grand triumphs). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
지다 = to lose (native Korean, casual — games, competitions, everyday)
패배하다 = to be defeated (Sino-Korean, formal — battles, significant losses, official contexts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 3 대 1로 졌다. / 선거에서 패배했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Lost 3 to 1. / Was defeated in the election.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 지다 and 패배하다: 지다 = to lose (native Korean, casual — games, competitions, everyday)
패배하다 = to be defeated (Sino-Korean, formal — battles, significant losses, official contexts). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
갈다 = to change / replace (native Korean, casual — swapping out worn items: tires, lightbulbs)
교체하다 = to replace (Sino-Korean, formal/official — personnel, equipment, systematic replacement)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 타이어를 갈아야 해. / 노후 장비를 교체할 예정이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I need to change the tires. / We plan to replace the aging equipment.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 갈다 and 교체하다: 갈다 = to change / replace (native Korean, casual — swapping out worn items: tires, lightbulbs)
교체하다 = to replace (Sino-Korean, formal/official — personnel, equipment, systematic replacement). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
좋아하다 = to like (general positive feeling — food, people, activities)
사랑하다 = to love (deep emotional bond — romantic, familial, passionate)
흠모하다 = to admire / adore (reverent admiration from afar — literary, one-sided deep respect)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 초콜릿을 좋아한다. / 가족을 사랑한다. / 오래전부터 그분을 흠모해 왔다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I like chocolate. / I love my family. / I have long admired that person from afar.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 좋아하다 = to like (general positive feeling — food, people, activities)
사랑하다 = to love (deep emotional bond — romantic, familial, passionate)
흠모하다 = to admire / adore (reverent admiration from afar — literary, one-sided deep respect). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
미안하다 = sorry (casual, everyday apology — among friends and equals)
죄송하다 = sorry (polite, standard formal apology — to superiors, strangers)
송구하다 = deeply sorry / ashamed (most formal, profound regret — public apologies, to high authority)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 미안, 늦었어. / 불편을 끼쳐 죄송합니다. / 이런 결과를 초래하여 송구합니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Sorry, I'm late. / I'm sorry for the inconvenience. / I am deeply sorry for causing this result.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 미안하다 = sorry (casual, everyday apology — among friends and equals)
죄송하다 = sorry (polite, standard formal apology — to superiors, strangers)
송구하다 = deeply sorry / ashamed (most formal, profound regret — public apologies, to high authority). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
싫다 = to dislike / not want (basic negative preference — mild to moderate)
혐오하다 = to loathe / detest (strong moral or visceral disgust — formal)
질색하다 = to be utterly repulsed / can't stand (emphatic revulsion — instinctive recoil)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 운동이 싫다. / 차별을 혐오한다. / 벌레라면 질색이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I don't like exercising. / I detest discrimination. / I absolutely can't stand bugs.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 싫다 = to dislike / not want (basic negative preference — mild to moderate)
혐오하다 = to loathe / detest (strong moral or visceral disgust — formal)
질색하다 = to be utterly repulsed / can't stand (emphatic revulsion — instinctive recoil). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
걱정하다 = to worry (everyday, personal — natural concern about outcomes)
우려하다 = to be concerned (formal, public — institutional or societal concerns)
염려하다 = to be worried (polite/literary — respectful concern, often toward or from elders)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 시험 걱정하지 마. / 환경 오염이 우려된다. / 부모님의 염려가 크시다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Don't worry about the exam. / There are concerns about environmental pollution. / My parents' worry is great.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 걱정하다 = to worry (everyday, personal — natural concern about outcomes)
우려하다 = to be concerned (formal, public — institutional or societal concerns)
염려하다 = to be worried (polite/literary — respectful concern, often toward or from elders). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
고맙다 = thankful (native Korean, warm and personal — heartfelt gratitude among close people)
감사하다 = grateful (Sino-Korean, formal — official thanks, polite expression to strangers or superiors)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 정말 고마워. / 도움에 진심으로 감사드립니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm really thankful. / I sincerely express my gratitude for your help.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 고맙다 and 감사하다: 고맙다 = thankful (native Korean, warm and personal — heartfelt gratitude among close people)
감사하다 = grateful (Sino-Korean, formal — official thanks, polite expression to strangers or superiors). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
기쁘다 = glad / happy (momentary joy from a specific event — news, success)
즐겁다 = enjoyable / fun (ongoing pleasant experience — activities, time spent)
행복하다 = happy (deep, lasting state of well-being — life satisfaction, contentment)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 합격 소식을 듣고 기뻤다. / 여행이 정말 즐거웠다. / 가족과 함께라서 행복하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was glad to hear the acceptance news. / The trip was really enjoyable. / I'm happy being with family.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 기쁘다 = glad / happy (momentary joy from a specific event — news, success)
즐겁다 = enjoyable / fun (ongoing pleasant experience — activities, time spent)
행복하다 = happy (deep, lasting state of well-being — life satisfaction, contentment). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
슬프다 = sad (general sadness — everyday emotional response)
비통하다 = grief-stricken / bitterly sorrowful (intense anguish — formal, overwhelming grief)
애통하다 = mournful / deeply grieving (ceremonial sorrow — eulogies, national mourning)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이별이 슬프다. / 소식을 듣고 비통함을 감출 수 없었다. / 온 국민이 애통해했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The farewell is sad. / Couldn't hide the bitter grief upon hearing the news. / The entire nation mourned.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 슬프다 = sad (general sadness — everyday emotional response)
비통하다 = grief-stricken / bitterly sorrowful (intense anguish — formal, overwhelming grief)
애통하다 = mournful / deeply grieving (ceremonial sorrow — eulogies, national mourning). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
놀라다 = to be surprised / startled (general, can be positive or negative — everyday surprise)
경악하다 = to be horrified / appalled (extreme shock at something terrible — formal, news-level)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 깜짝 선물에 놀랐다. / 참사 소식에 전 세계가 경악했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was surprised by the surprise gift. / The entire world was horrified at the news of the disaster.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 놀라다 and 경악하다: 놀라다 = to be surprised / startled (general, can be positive or negative — everyday surprise)
경악하다 = to be horrified / appalled (extreme shock at something terrible — formal, news-level). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~때문에 = because of (neutral cause — no inherent positive/negative connotation)
~탓에 = because of / due to (negative cause — blame, unfortunate outcome)
~덕분에 = thanks to (positive cause — gratitude, fortunate outcome)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 비 때문에 못 갔다. / 부주의한 탓에 사고가 났다. / 선생님 덕분에 합격했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Couldn't go because of rain. / An accident happened due to carelessness. / I passed thanks to my teacher.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: ~때문에 = because of (neutral cause — no inherent positive/negative connotation)
~탓에 = because of / due to (negative cause — blame, unfortunate outcome)
~덕분에 = thanks to (positive cause — gratitude, fortunate outcome). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~(으)려고 = in order to (spoken, casual intention — everyday purpose)
~고자 = in order to / with the aim of (formal/written intention — speeches, official documents)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 밥 먹으려고 나갔다. / 국민의 신뢰를 얻고자 노력하겠습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I went out to eat. / I will strive to earn the people's trust.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare ~(으)려고 and ~고자: ~(으)려고 = in order to (spoken, casual intention — everyday purpose)
~고자 = in order to / with the aim of (formal/written intention — speeches, official documents). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~지만 = but / although (standard, conversational contrast)
~(으)나 = but / however (formal/written contrast — concise, literary)
~에도 불구하고 = despite / in spite of (strongest concession — formal, emphasizing overcoming obstacles)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 비싸지만 좋다. / 노력했으나 실패했다. / 어려움에도 불구하고 끝까지 해냈다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's expensive but good. / I tried, but failed. / Despite difficulties, I pulled through to the end.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: ~지만 = but / although (standard, conversational contrast)
~(으)나 = but / however (formal/written contrast — concise, literary)
~에도 불구하고 = despite / in spite of (strongest concession — formal, emphasizing overcoming obstacles). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아직 = still / not yet (time-focused — something expected hasn't happened yet, or continues from before)
여전히 = still / as before (state-focused — an unchanged condition persisting despite expectations of change)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아직 안 왔어. / 10년이 지났지만 여전히 아름답다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He hasn't come yet. / Ten years have passed, but she's still beautiful as ever.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 아직 and 여전히: 아직 = still / not yet (time-focused — something expected hasn't happened yet, or continues from before)
여전히 = still / as before (state-focused — an unchanged condition persisting despite expectations of change). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
갑자기 = suddenly (general, everyday — abrupt change or event)
불현듯 = all of a sudden (literary — something flashing into awareness, often thoughts or realizations)
돌연 = abruptly (formal/literary — sudden dramatic shift in situation or behavior)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 갑자기 비가 왔다. / 불현듯 옛 기억이 떠올랐다. / 그는 돌연 태도를 바꿨다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It suddenly rained. / An old memory suddenly flashed to mind. / He abruptly changed his attitude.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 갑자기 = suddenly (general, everyday — abrupt change or event)
불현듯 = all of a sudden (literary — something flashing into awareness, often thoughts or realizations)
돌연 = abruptly (formal/literary — sudden dramatic shift in situation or behavior). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
즉시 = immediately (formal, no delay — official directives, legal)
당장 = right now / right away (urgent, emphatic — demanding immediate action)
곧바로 = straight away / directly (sequential — going to the next thing without detour)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 즉시 조치를 취하겠습니다. / 당장 그만둬! / 회의가 끝나고 곧바로 출발했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: We will take action immediately. / Stop it right now! / Left straight away after the meeting ended.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 즉시 = immediately (formal, no delay — official directives, legal)
당장 = right now / right away (urgent, emphatic — demanding immediate action)
곧바로 = straight away / directly (sequential — going to the next thing without detour). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
일부러 = on purpose / deliberately (casual, personal choice — going out of one's way)
고의로 = intentionally / with malice (legal/negative — premeditated wrongdoing)
의도적으로 = intentionally / by design (neutral-formal — planned action, can be positive or negative)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 일부러 찾아갔다. / 고의로 증거를 인멸했다. / 의도적으로 정보를 누락했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I went there on purpose. / Intentionally destroyed evidence. / Deliberately omitted information.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 일부러 = on purpose / deliberately (casual, personal choice — going out of one's way)
고의로 = intentionally / with malice (legal/negative — premeditated wrongdoing)
의도적으로 = intentionally / by design (neutral-formal — planned action, can be positive or negative). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아무리 = no matter how much (concessive emphasis — even if you try your best)
비록 = although / even though (formal concession — acknowledging a fact but countering it)
설령 = even if / supposing (hypothetical extreme concession — even in the worst case)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아무리 바빠도 밥은 먹어야지. / 비록 작은 힘이지만 보태겠다. / 설령 실패하더라도 후회하지 않겠다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: No matter how busy you are, you should eat. / Although it's a small contribution, I'll help. / Even if I fail, I won't regret it.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 아무리 = no matter how much (concessive emphasis — even if you try your best)
비록 = although / even though (formal concession — acknowledging a fact but countering it)
설령 = even if / supposing (hypothetical extreme concession — even in the worst case). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~처럼 = like / as (standard comparison — versatile, spoken and written)
~같이 = like / together (casual comparison or togetherness — spoken preference)
~듯(이) = as if / as though (literary, nuanced — seeming, appearance-based comparison)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 꿈처럼 아름답다. / 나같이 하면 돼. / 모든 것을 알고 있었다는 듯이 웃었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Beautiful like a dream. / Just do it like me. / Smiled as if knowing everything.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: ~처럼 = like / as (standard comparison — versatile, spoken and written)
~같이 = like / together (casual comparison or togetherness — spoken preference)
~듯(이) = as if / as though (literary, nuanced — seeming, appearance-based comparison). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
또한 = also / in addition (standard addition — written and spoken, neutral)
아울러 = additionally / along with (formal — official announcements, adding a request or note alongside the main point)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 건강에 좋고 또한 맛도 좋다. / 감사 인사를 드리며, 아울러 한 가지 부탁을 드립니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's good for health and also tastes good. / I extend my thanks, and additionally have one request.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 또한 and 아울러: 또한 = also / in addition (standard addition — written and spoken, neutral)
아울러 = additionally / along with (formal — official announcements, adding a request or note alongside the main point). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
만약 = if / in case (standard conditional — hypothetical situations)
혹시 = by any chance / perhaps (tentative, polite uncertainty — softening a question or possibility)
설사 = even if / even supposing (extreme hypothetical concession — formal, 'even in that case')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 만약 시간이 있으면 와. / 혹시 이거 아세요? / 설사 그가 사실을 말했더라도 믿기 어렵다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: If you have time, come by. / By any chance, do you know this? / Even if he told the truth, it's hard to believe.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 만약 = if / in case (standard conditional — hypothetical situations)
혹시 = by any chance / perhaps (tentative, polite uncertainty — softening a question or possibility)
설사 = even if / even supposing (extreme hypothetical concession — formal, 'even in that case'). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
약간 = slightly / somewhat (a small amount — slightly more formal than 조금)
조금 = a little / a bit (everyday, most common minimal quantity)
다소 = somewhat / to some extent (formal, hedging — acknowledging a degree in written or formal speech)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 약간 짜다. / 조금만 기다려. / 다소 무리한 요구였다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's slightly salty. / Wait just a little. / It was a somewhat unreasonable request.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 약간 = slightly / somewhat (a small amount — slightly more formal than 조금)
조금 = a little / a bit (everyday, most common minimal quantity)
다소 = somewhat / to some extent (formal, hedging — acknowledging a degree in written or formal speech). Use in appropriate register.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be merely; nothing more than
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이것은 시작에 불과하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This is merely the beginning.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 불(只) = merely. 과(過) = pass. Literally 'no more than passing.' Used in formal speech to diminish or minimize. Related: 겨우(barely), 정도(about), 뿐(only)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regardless of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 남녀를 불문하고 지원 가능합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You can apply regardless of gender.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 불(不) = not. 문(問) = ask. Literally 'without asking.' Means regardless of without making distinctions. Common in official documents. Related: 상관없이(regardless), 막론하고(irrespective)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: based on; grounded in
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사실에 입각하여 판단해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You must judge based on facts.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 입(立) = stand. 각(脚) = foot/leg. Literally 'standing on.' Used in formal writing to mean 'based on.' Related: 입장(standpoint), 각도(angle), 기초(foundation)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: equivalent to; on par with
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정규직에 준하는 대우를 받는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Receiving treatment on par with full-time employees.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 준(準) = according to/standard. Means equivalent to or on par with. Formal comparison term. Related: 준비(preparation), 준칙(rule), 준수(compliance)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: starting with; led by
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대통령을 위시하여 관계자들이 참석했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Officials attended, led by the president.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 위(位) = position. 시(始) = begin. Literally 'beginning from the position of.' Means starting with or led by. Related: 위치(location), 시작(start), 처음(beginning)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be absorbed in; devoted entirely to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그는 연구에 여념이 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: He is entirely absorbed in research.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 여(餘) = remaining/spare. 념(念) = thought/mind. Literally 'no spare thoughts.' Means entirely devoted or absorbed. Related: 집중(concentration), 관심(interest), 열정(passion)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to recall; to be reminded of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 초심을 상기해야 할 때다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It's time to recall our original intentions.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 상(上) = above/recall. 기(記) = record. Literally 'to record above.' Formal way to mean 'recall' or 'remind.' Related: 기억(memory), 상관(boss), 상징(symbol)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be attributable to; to originate from
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 문제는 소통 부재에 기인한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This problem is attributable to a lack of communication.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 기(起) = arise/originate. 인(因) = cause/reason. Literally 'to originate from the cause.' Used to express attribution. Related: 기원(origin), 원인(cause), 인과(causality)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be reminiscent of; to rival
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 전쟁터를 방불케 하는 현장이었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It was a scene reminiscent of a battlefield.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 방(傍) = beside/similar. 불(佛) = not/Buddha. 케(케) = make. Archaic/literary. Means to rival or be reminiscent of. Related: 방치(neglect), 방향(direction)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to contribute to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사회 발전에 이바지하고 싶다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I want to contribute to the development of society.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 이(利) = benefit. 바(拔) = pull out. 지(支) = support. Means to contribute to. Formal term. Related: 이득(benefit), 이익(profit), 이사(director)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: due to; because of (formal cause)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 폭우로 인해 도로가 통제되고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Roads are being restricted due to heavy rain.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 인(因) = cause. 해(害) = by. Formal cause marker. Common in news/reports. Related: 인과(causality), 인물(person), 인정(recognition)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in light of; considering
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 과거 사례에 비추어 볼 때 이번에도 같은 결과가 예상된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In light of past cases, the same result is expected this time.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 비(比) = compare. 추(推) = infer. Literally 'comparing and inferring.' Means 'in light of' in formal contexts. Related: 비교(comparison), 추론(inference)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: prior to; before (formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 회의에 앞서 간단한 인사가 있겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Prior to the meeting, there will be a brief greeting.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 앞(前) = front. 서(先) = first. Means prior to before (formal). Related: 앞날(future), 선택(choice), 선행(precedent)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regardless of; irrespective of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이념을 막론하고 민생이 우선이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Regardless of ideology, people's livelihoods come first.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 막(莫) = not/no. 론(論) = discuss. Literally 'without discussion.' Means regardless of. Related: 논의(discussion), 논문(thesis)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: owing to; on account of (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그의 실수로 말미암아 프로젝트가 지연되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Owing to his mistake, the project was delayed.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 말(末) = end. 미(彌) = fill. 암(暗) = dark. Very formal/literary. Means owing to or on account of. Related: 말미(end), 미루다(postpone)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: ranging to; extending up to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 어린이에서 노인에 이르기까지 모두가 참여했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Everyone participated, from children to the elderly.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 이(至) = reach. 르(르) = reach. 기(期) = period. Means ranging to or extending up to. Related: 이상(above), 이전(before)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: is nothing other than; is precisely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이것은 국민에 대한 배신에 다름 아니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This is nothing other than a betrayal of the people.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 다름(differ) = differ. 아니다 = is not. Literally 'is not different from,' meaning 'is precisely.' Formal emphasis. Related: 다양(diversity), 아니면(otherwise)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: is nothing more than; merely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그건 변명에 지나지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: That's nothing more than an excuse.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 지(止) = stop. 나(那) = that. Means is nothing more than or merely. Related: 지난(past), 나아가(furthermore)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to reach the point of; to come to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 결국 파산하기에 이르렀다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It eventually reached the point of bankruptcy.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 이(至) = reach. Means to reach the point of or come to. Formal/literary. Related: 이루다(accomplish), 이상(above)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not only... but also (written/formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 실력이 뛰어날 뿐더러 인품도 훌륭하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Not only is their skill outstanding, but their character is excellent too.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 뿐(只) = only. 더(더) = more. 러(러) = than. Means not only but also. Written/formal. Related: 뿐만 아니라(not only)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it's a good thing that...; fortunately (otherwise...)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 빨리 발견할 망정이지 늦었으면 큰일 날 뻔했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Good thing it was discovered quickly — any later and it would have been a disaster.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 망(望) = hope/look. 정(定) = decide. 이지 = but. Means it's a good thing that or fortunately. Related: 망설이다(hesitate), 정하다(decide)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I would say that; in my humble opinion (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 생각건대 이 문제는 쉽게 해결되지 않을 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In my estimation, this problem will not be easily resolved.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 건(乾) = dry/just. 대(代) = behalf. Means 'now that' or 'since' in formal argument. Archaic. Related: 건설(construction), 대신(instead)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: consider it as; treat it as if
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경험을 쌓는 셈치고 해 보자.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Let's do it, considering it as gaining experience.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 셈(數) = count. 치 = treat. 고 = and. Means counting or treating as. Formal construction. Related: 셈 = counting, 계산(calculation)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not stopping at; going beyond just
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 단순한 비판에 그치지 않고 대안을 제시해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You shouldn't stop at mere criticism — you need to present alternatives.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 데(地) = place. 그치 = stop. 않 = not. 고 = and. Means not stopping at but also. Continuation. Related: 그치다(stop), 않다(not)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: can only; all one can do is; merely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 감사할 따름입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I can only be grateful.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 따름(隨) = follow. Means merely following or as a result. Formal conclusion. Related: 따르다(follow), 이름(name)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as (was stated/done); the fact that; having (done)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 앞서 언급한 바와 같이 이 문제는 시급하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: As was mentioned earlier, this issue is urgent.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 바(把) = matter/way. Means the matter/fact of doing. Formal nominalization. Related: 바꾸다(change), 바뀌다(change)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: on the occasion of; at the time of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 창립 50주년에 즈음하여 기념행사를 개최합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: On the occasion of the 50th anniversary, a commemorative event will be held.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 즈음(時) = time. 하여 = do. Means at the time of or on the occasion of. Formal temporal. Related: 때(time), 하다(do)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: given that; considering that (archaic/formal concessive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사태가 이에 이를진대 더 이상 방관할 수 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that the situation has reached this point, we can no longer stand by.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 진대(進大) = go forward. Old form of conditional. Means if one were to. Archaic conditional. Related: 진행(progress), 대신(instead)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: by means of; by doing (instrumental — distinguishing from ~(으)로서 'as/in the capacity of')
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 지속적인 연구로써 문제를 해결할 수 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The problem can be solved by means of continuous research.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 써(써) = with. Means by means of or with (instrumental, formal). Related: 서다(stand), 써다(use)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as long as; so long as; to the extent that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 법이 허용하는 한 최선을 다하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I will do my best as long as the law permits.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 한 = while/as. Means while or as long as. Temporal conjunction. Related: 한계(limit), 한정(restriction)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: even if only; at least (concessive — settling for less)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 작은 도움이나마 되고 싶습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I want to be of help, even if only a little.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 나(那) = that. 마(麻) = hemp. 마 = even. Means even just or at least. Minimal concession. Related: 나마(even), 어쨌든(anyway)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: cannot help but; have no choice but to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 현 상황에서는 구조조정을 할 수밖에 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In the current situation, there is no choice but to restructure.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 수(數) = number. 밖(外) = outside. 없 = have not. Means can only or must. Necessity. Related: 수단(means), 밖(outside)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: now that; since (it is the case that)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 약속한 이상 반드시 지켜야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Now that you've made a promise, you must keep it.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 이상(以上) = above. Means since/now that. Implication of consequence. Related: 이상(above), 상태(state)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: including; starting with; such as
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 한국을 비롯하여 동아시아 국가들이 참여했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: East Asian countries including Korea participated.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 비(比) = compare. 롯(落) = fall. Means starting with or beginning with. Related: 비교(comparison), 낙하(fall)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: given the circumstances that; since (with background situation)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 예산이 부족한 터에 추가 지출은 어렵다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that the budget is insufficient, additional spending is difficult.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 터(터) = place/basis. Means on the basis that. Causal ground. Related: 터전(basis), 터파기(excavation)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is a possibility/risk of; could potentially
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 조항은 오해를 불러일으킬 소지가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This clause has the potential to cause misunderstandings.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 소지(所持) = having. 있다 = exists. Means there is a possibility of. Potential. Related: 소재(location), 지니다(possess)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in accordance with; pursuant to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 법률에 의거하여 처분을 내렸다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The disposition was made pursuant to the relevant laws.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 의(由) = by. 거(據) = base. 하여 = do. Means based on (formal). Related: 의견(opinion), 거점(base)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: on the other hand; while; whereas
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 수출은 증가한 반면 내수는 감소했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: While exports increased, domestic demand decreased.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 반(反) = opposite. 면(面) = side. Means on the other hand. Contrastive. Related: 반대(opposition), 면접(interview)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not only... but also
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경제적 손실뿐만 아니라 인명 피해도 발생했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Not only economic losses but also casualties occurred.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 뿐(只) = only. 만(滿) = full. Means not only but also. Extended negation. Related: 뿐(only), 만족(satisfaction)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: according to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 통계청 자료에 따르면 출산율이 역대 최저를 기록했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: According to Statistics Korea data, the birth rate hit a record low.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 따(隨) = follow. 르 = (suffix). 면 = if. Means according to (quotation formula). Related: 따르다(follow), 말(speech)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it amounts to; it's as if; effectively
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 하루에 커피를 세 잔 마시니 한 달에 15만 원을 쓰는 셈이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Drinking three cups of coffee a day, it amounts to spending 150,000 won per month.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 셈(數) = count. Means it counts as or is like counting. Evaluation. Related: 셈(counting), 이다(is)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is room for / there is no room for
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 사안에 대해서는 논의의 여지가 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is no room for discussion on this matter.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 여(餘) = spare. 지(地) = place. Means room for/not room for. Possibility. Related: 여행(travel), 지역(region)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it stands to reason that; one might well (expect)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그 정도면 화를 낼 법도 하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that much, it's understandable that one might get angry.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 법(法) = law/way. 하다 = do. Means should or would tend to. Normative. Related: 법칙(rule), 방법(method)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: precisely; none other than; truly (emphatic topic marker)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 교육이야말로 국가의 미래를 좌우하는 핵심이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Education is precisely the key that determines a nation's future.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 야(也) = (emphatic). 말(말) = speak. 로 = (instrumental). Means as for/precisely. Strong emphasis. Related: 야생(wild), 말(speech)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in contrast to; whereas; while on the other hand
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 젊은 층이 찬성하는 데 반해 기성세대는 반대하고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: While the younger generation is in favor, the older generation is opposed.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 데(地) = place. 반(反) = opposite. 해(害) = harm/by. Means "in contrast to" with strong opposition implied. Formal contrast marker emphasizing difference. Related: 반면(on the other hand), 반대(opposition)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: amid; in the midst of; while
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경기 침체가 심화되는 가운데 실업률이 상승하고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Amid the deepening recession, the unemployment rate is rising.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 가(加) = add. 운(運) = fortune. 데(地) = place. Means among or while. Related: 가능(possibility), 운명(fate)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: given that it will be the case; since it is expected that (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 예산이 삭감될 터인즉 대안을 마련해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that the budget will be cut, we must prepare alternatives.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 터 = basis/situation. 인즉(因則) = given the cause. Archaic formal conditional meaning "given that." Literary form expressing logical consequence. Related: 터전(foundation), 인과(causality)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: because of; as a result of (unexpected/undesirable cause)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 갑자기 비가 오는 바람에 행사가 취소되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Because it suddenly rained, the event was canceled.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 바람 = wind (figurative: circumstance). Marks unexpected/undesirable cause. Informal-origin pattern used in formal narrative. Related: 바람직하다(desirable), 원인(cause)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: if one intends to; if one is going to (formal/literary conditional)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 성공할 양이면 남다른 노력이 필요하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: If one intends to succeed, extraordinary effort is required.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 양(樣) = manner/way. Literary conditional "if one intends to" expressing hypothetical condition with determination. Related: 양식(form), 의도(intention)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in that; in the sense that; from the standpoint that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 국민에게 영향을 미친다는 점에서 신중한 접근이 필요하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In that it affects all citizens, a cautious approach is needed.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 점(點) = point. Marks specific aspect being evaluated. Formal marker meaning "in that/in the sense that." Related: 관점(viewpoint), 측면(aspect)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been reported that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 피해자는 현재 병원에서 치료를 받고 있는 것으로 전해졌다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It has been reported that the victim is currently receiving treatment at a hospital.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 전(傳) = transmit. Means it has been reported or transmitted that. News formula. Related: 전달(transmission), 해석(interpretation)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is known that; it has been revealed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 기업은 이미 파산 절차에 들어간 것으로 알려졌다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is known that the company has already entered bankruptcy proceedings.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Passive reportative construction. 알(知) = know. 져 = become. Common in news for indirect information. Related: 알다(know), 전해지다(be reported)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been found/shown that (reporting survey or data results)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 조사 결과 시민의 70%가 정책에 반대하는 것으로 나타났다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The survey found that 70% of citizens oppose the policy.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 나타(現) = appear. Survey/data reporting formula meaning "it has been found." Objective presentation of findings. Related: 나타나다(appear), 드러나다(be revealed)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been confirmed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사고 원인은 운전자의 부주의인 것으로 확인되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It has been confirmed that the cause of the accident was the driver's negligence.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 확(確) = certain. 인(認) = recognize. Strong factual confirmation. Official verification language. Related: 확실하다(certain), 인정하다(acknowledge)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been uncovered/revealed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 공금을 유용한 사실이 감사를 통해 드러났다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It was revealed through an audit that public funds had been embezzled.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 드러(露) = reveal. Means it was revealed or became evident that. News formula. Related: 드러나다(become evident), 나다(appear)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is projected/expected that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 내년 경제 성장률은 2%대에 머물 전망이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The economic growth rate is projected to remain at around 2% next year.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 전(展) = unfold. 망(望) = view/outlook. Projection formula for predictions. Common in economic/policy reporting. Related: 전개(development), 전망(outlook)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it appears/seems that (journalistic hedging)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 양측의 합의까지는 상당한 시간이 걸릴 것으로 보인다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It appears that reaching an agreement between the two sides will take considerable time.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 보 = see/view. Hedging formula expressing tentative assessment. Journalistic softening of claims. Related: 보이다(appear), 보다(see)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is the policy/plan to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 내년부터 규제를 대폭 완화할 방침이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government plans to significantly ease regulations starting next year.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 방(方) = direction. 침(針) = needle/policy. Official policy announcement formula. Government/corporate decision language. Related: 방향(direction), 정책(policy)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to step forward to; to take action toward
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 시민단체들이 환경 보호를 위한 캠페인에 나섰다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Civic groups have stepped forward to campaign for environmental protection.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 나서 = step forward. Active participation/initiative marker. Formal action verb for beginning engagement. Related: 나아가다(advance), 착수하다(commence)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to urge; to call for
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 야당은 정부에 즉각적인 대책 마련을 촉구했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The opposition party urged the government to prepare immediate countermeasures.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 촉(促) = urge. 구(求) = request. Means to urge or call for. Related: 촉발(triggering), 요구(demand)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to cause ripples/repercussions
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대표이사의 돌연 사임으로 업계에 큰 파장이 일고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The CEO's sudden resignation is causing major repercussions in the industry.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 파(波) = wave. 장(長) = long/chief. 일 = rise. To cause ripples/repercussions. Figurative: effects spreading like waves. Related: 파문(ripple effect), 영향(influence), 반향(repercussion)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: controversy arises; to spark debate
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 새로운 교육 정책을 둘러싸고 논란이 일고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Controversy is arising over the new education policy.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 논(論) = discuss. 란(亂) = chaos/dispute. 일 = rise. Controversy arises/sparks debate. Related: 논쟁(debate), 쟁점(issue), 의견(opinion)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: the outcome is being closely watched
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대법원의 최종 판결에 귀추가 주목된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The outcome of the Supreme Court's final ruling is being closely watched.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 귀(歸) = return. 추(趨) = trend. 주(注) = pour. 목(目) = eye. The outcome/trend is closely watched. Literary idiom. Related: 귀결(conclusion), 추세(trend), 주목(attention)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is forecast/expected that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 올해 수출액은 사상 최고치를 기록할 것으로 전망된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Exports this year are forecast to reach a record high.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 전(展) = unfold. 망(望) = view. Passive forecast construction. Economic/statistical projection language. Related: 전망(forecast), 예상되다(be expected)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is a trend that; there is a tendency toward
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 비대면 서비스를 선호하는 소비자가 늘어나는 추세이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is a growing trend of consumers preferring contactless services.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 추(推) = infer. 세(勢) = momentum. Trend identification formula. Statistical/social pattern description. Related: 추이(trend), 경향(tendency)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to examine; to investigate (academically)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 연구에서는 한국 사회의 저출산 원인을 고찰하고자 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This study aims to examine the causes of low birth rates in Korean society.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 고찰(考察) - 考(think) + 察(examine). Pattern: N을/를 고찰하다 (examine/investigate N academically). Used in research papers to indicate thorough examination. Related: 검토하다(review), 분석하다(analyze), 연구하다(research).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to discuss; to argue (in academic discourse)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 효율성만을 논할 것이 아니라 공정성도 고려해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We should not only discuss efficiency but also consider fairness.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 논(論) means discuss/argue. Pattern: N을/를 논하다 (discuss/argue N). Very formal academic/philosophical discourse. Related: 논의하다(discuss), 토론하다(debate), 거론하다(bring up for discussion).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in terms of; when it comes to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정책을 수립하는 데 있어 국민의 의견을 반영해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: When it comes to establishing policy, public opinion must be reflected.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 있어 = be at. Marks domain/context of consideration. Formal "when it comes to/in terms of." Related: 에 있어서(in), 관하여(regarding)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be premised on; on the assumption of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 이론은 합리적 경제 주체를 전제로 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This theory is premised on rational economic agents.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 전제(前提) - 前(before) + 提(raise). Pattern: N을/를 전제로 하다 (on the premise of N / taking N as a given). Logical/academic writing. Related: 가정하다(assume), 바탕으로 하다(based on).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be limited/confined to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 현상은 특정 지역에 국한되지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This phenomenon is not confined to a specific region.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 국한(局限) - 局(limit) + 限(restrict). Pattern: N에 국한되다 (be limited/confined to N). Passive form indicating restriction. Related: 제한되다(be limited), 한정되다(be confined).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is thought/considered that (formal academic)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 추가적인 연구가 필요한 것으로 사료된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is considered that additional research is necessary.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 사(思) = think. 료(慮) = consider. Academic/formal assessment. Very formal "it is thought that." Related: 사고(thought), 고려(consideration)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is a need to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기존 연구의 한계를 극복할 필요가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is a need to overcome the limitations of existing research.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 필(必) = must. 요(要) = need. Necessity expression. Academic recommendation language. Related: 필수(essential), 요구(requirement)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be correlated with
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 교육 수준과 소득은 밀접한 상관관계가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Education level and income are closely correlated.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 상(相) = mutual. 관(關) = relation. Statistical correlation statement. Research/analysis terminology. Related: 상호(mutual), 관계(relationship)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to suggest; to imply (in academic/analytical context)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 결과는 기존 이론의 재검토가 필요함을 시사한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: These results suggest that a re-examination of existing theories is necessary.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 시사(示唆) - 示(show) + 唆(suggest). Pattern: N을/를 시사하다 (suggest/imply N). Used in analysis to indicate implications. Related: 암시하다(hint), 제시하다(present), 나타내다(show).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be based on; to be grounded in
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 논문의 분석은 실증적 데이터에 근거한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The analysis in this paper is grounded in empirical data.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 근거(根據) - 根(root) + 據(basis). Pattern: N에 근거하다 (be based on N / be grounded in N). Indicates evidential basis. Related: 기초하다(be based on), 바탕으로 하다(based on).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be in violation of; to contravene
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 행위는 현행법에 저촉될 수 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The act in question may contravene current law.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 저촉(抵觸) - 抵(resist) + 觸(touch). Pattern: N에 저촉되다 (be in violation of N / contravene N). Legal term for violating rules/laws. Related: 위반하다(violate), 어기다(break).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to promulgate; to officially announce (a law)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 개정된 법률을 관보에 공포했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government promulgated the amended law in the official gazette.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 공포(公布) - 公(public) + 布(spread). Pattern: N을/를 공포하다 (promulgate N). Used for officially announcing laws/regulations. Related: 발표하다(announce), 선포하다(proclaim), 공표하다(publish).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to fall under; to constitute
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 행위는 사기죄에 해당한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This act constitutes fraud.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 해당(該當) - 該(that) + 當(correspond). Pattern: N에 해당하다 (fall under N / correspond to N). Legal/administrative classification. Related: 속하다(belong), 적용되다(apply).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to have the obligation to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 고용주는 근로자의 안전을 보장할 의무가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The employer has the obligation to guarantee workers' safety.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 의무(義務) - 義(righteous) + 務(duty). Pattern: V(으)ㄹ 의무가 있다 (have the obligation to V). Legal/formal obligation. Related: 책임이 있다(be responsible), 해야 한다(must).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regarding; concerning (used in legal/official titles and documents)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 개인정보 보호에 관한 법률이 개정되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The law regarding personal information protection has been amended.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to regard as; to deem
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기한 내 회신이 없을 경우 동의한 것으로 간주합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: If no reply is received within the deadline, it will be deemed as consent.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 간(看) = consider. 주(主) = main. Means to consider or regard. Related: 간단(simple), 주요(main)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to comply with; to observe (rules, laws)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 참가자는 대회 규정을 준수해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: All participants must comply with the competition regulations.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 준수(遵守) - 遵(follow) + 守(guard). Pattern: N을/를 준수하다 (comply with N / observe N). Formal compliance with rules/laws. Related: 지키다(keep), 따르다(follow), 복종하다(obey).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: commensurate with; corresponding to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위반의 정도에 상응하는 처벌이 내려질 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Punishment commensurate with the degree of the violation will be imposed.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in accordance with what was (decided/stated)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이사회에서 결의한 바에 따라 인사 개편을 단행합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In accordance with the board's resolution, a personnel reorganization will be carried out.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 바 = matter/way. 따 = follow. "In accordance with what was done." Formal procedural language. Related: 따르다(follow), 의하여(according to)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to not permit; to prohibit
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 당국은 무허가 시위를 불허한다고 밝혔다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The authorities stated that unauthorized protests will not be permitted.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 불허(不許) - 不(not) + 許(permit). Pattern: N을/를 불허하다 (not permit N / prohibit N). Strong formal prohibition. Related: 금지하다(prohibit), 허락하지 않다(not allow).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I promise to (formal pledge to audience)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국민의 기대에 부응할 것을 약속드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I promise to live up to the expectations of the people.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I will do my best to (formal commitment)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국민의 안전을 지키는 데 최선을 다하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I will do my best to protect the safety of the people.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please (do something) (formal request/directive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 질서를 유지해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Please maintain order.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 시 = honorific. 바 = wish/desire. Formal request formula with honored subject. Polite directive language. Related: 바라다(wish), 부탁하다(request)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I intend to; I would like to (formal speech opener)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 오늘은 우리 회사의 미래 전략에 대해 말씀드리고자 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Today, I would like to speak about our company's future strategy.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 고자 = intend to. Formal intention marker from literary Korean. Announces purpose/plan formally. Related: 의도(intention), 목적(purpose)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I earnestly request/urge that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 안전 수칙을 철저히 지켜 주실 것을 당부드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I earnestly urge you to thoroughly observe the safety regulations.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 당(當) = appropriate. 부(付) = entrust. Earnest request/urging formula. Solemn appeal language. Related: 당부(request), 부탁(favor)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I humbly request that you (very polite request)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 서류를 기한 내에 제출해 주시기를 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I request that you submit the relevant documents within the deadline.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Maximal politeness request combining honorific layers. Business/formal letter standard. Related: 부탁(request), 드리다(humble give)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: inasmuch as; given that; to the extent that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모두가 노력한 만큼 좋은 결과가 있을 것입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that everyone has worked hard, there will be good results.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 만큼 = as much as. Proportional relationship marker. "To the extent that/inasmuch as." Related: 정도(degree), 한도(limit)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to express one's deepest (gratitude, condolences, or apology)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 유족에게 심심한 위로의 말씀을 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I express my deepest condolences to the bereaved family.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 심(深) = deep. 심(深) = deep. 사(謝) = thanks. 의(意) = feeling. 표(表) = express. To express deepest gratitude or condolences. Ceremonial language. Related: 심심(deepest), 사의(thanks), 조의(condolences)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I wish to inform you that (formal notification)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 다음 달부터 운영 시간이 변경됨을 알려 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I wish to inform you that operating hours will change starting next month.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 알리 = inform. 드 = humble. Formal notification formula for announcements. Related: 알리다(notify), 통지(notice)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please take note of; please be mindful of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 출입 시 보안 절차에 유의하시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Please take note of the security procedures upon entry.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 유(留) = retain. 의(意) = mind. "Please take note of/be mindful of." Warning/reminder formula. Related: 유념(mindfulness), 주의(caution)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: shall; will (literary future expressing resolve or prophecy)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 땅에 평화가 찾아오리라 믿는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I believe peace shall come to this land.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Archaic future/presumptive ending. Literary will/shall expressing resolve or prophecy. Classical Korean. Related: 것이다(will be), 터이다(will)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: although it would be; even though (literary concessive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 가고 싶으련마는 사정이 허락하지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Although I would like to go, circumstances do not permit it.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Literary concessive "although it would be." Classical concessive contradiction. Related: 지만(but), 그러나(however)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I have been doing; I declare that I (archaic/literary declarative)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 평생을 이 연구에 바쳐 왔노라.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I have devoted my entire life to this research.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Archaic declarative ending. Literary "I declare that I." Classical Korean first-person assertion. Related: 다(declarative), 라고 하다(say that)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: may it be so!; let there be (literary optative/wish)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 이가 자유를 누릴지어다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: May all people enjoy freedom.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Optative/wish ending. Literary "may it be so/let there be." Classical Korean blessing form. Related: 기를(hope), 바라노니(wish)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: for; since (literary causal reasoning)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 세월은 기다려 주지 않을지니 오늘을 최선을 다해 살아라.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: For time waits for no one, live today to the fullest.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Literary causal "for/since." Classical Korean reasoning connector. Related: 이니까(because), 때문에(due to)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to bring an item/agenda to the table; to submit an agenda item
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이번 이사회에서 신규 사업 안건을 상정할 예정입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We plan to bring the new business agenda item to the table at this board meeting.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 안(案) = proposal. 건(件) = matter. 상(上) = submit. 정(定) = agenda. 하 = do. To formally bring an agenda item to the table for deliberation. Related: 안내(guidance), 건의(suggestion), 상황(situation), 정책(policy)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to prepare the meeting minutes
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 총무부에서 금일 회의록을 작성하여 배포해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The general affairs department is requested to prepare and distribute today's meeting minutes.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 회(會) = meeting. 의(議) = discuss. 록(錄) = record. 작(作) = make. 성(成) = complete. To prepare meeting minutes. Administrative documentation. Related: 회의(meeting), 기록(record), 문서(document)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to submit (a document) for approval
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 출장 경비에 대한 결재를 상신하였으나 아직 승인되지 않았습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The approval request for travel expenses was submitted, but it has not yet been approved.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 결(決) = decide. 재(裁) = judgment. 상(上) = up. 신(申) = submit. To submit for approval up the chain. Corporate/government procedure. Related: 결재(approval), 승인(authorization), 보고(report)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to hand over duties; to transfer responsibilities
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 퇴직 전에 후임자에게 업무를 인수인계해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You must hand over your duties to your successor before leaving the company.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 업(業) = work. 무(務) = duty. 인(引) = pull. 수(受) = receive. 인(引) = pull. 계(繼) = continue. To hand over duties/transfer responsibilities. Job transition terminology. Related: 인수(takeover), 인계(handover), 이관(transfer)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: via; by way of; through (the channel of)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 대외 문서는 법무팀을 경유하여 발송해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: All external documents must be sent via the legal team.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to conclude/enter into a contract
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 양사는 3년간의 공급 계약을 체결하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Both companies concluded a three-year supply contract.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 계(契) = pledge. 약(約) = promise. 체(締) = tie. 결(結) = bind. To conclude/enter into contract. Legal/business terminology. Related: 계약(contract), 체결(conclusion), 합의(agreement)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to report on performance/results
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 분기별 실적을 보고하는 자리를 마련하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We will arrange an occasion to report on quarterly performance.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 실(實) = real. 적(績) = achievement. 보(報) = report. 고(告) = announce. To report performance/results. Business reporting language. Related: 실적(performance), 성과(results), 보고(report)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to commence; to embark on; to undertake
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 내년 초 신규 프로젝트에 착수할 계획입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We plan to commence the new project at the beginning of next year.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 착수(着手) - 着(attach) + 手(hand). Pattern: N에 착수하다 (commence N / embark on N). Formal beginning of project/work. Related: 시작하다(start), 개시하다(commence).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to entrust entirely; to delegate fully
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 세부 일정은 실무진에 일임하기로 결정하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It has been decided to fully delegate the detailed schedule to the working-level staff.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 일임(一任) - 一(one) + 任(entrust). Pattern: N을/를 일임하다 (entrust N entirely / delegate N fully). Complete delegation of authority. Related: 맡기다(entrust), 위임하다(delegate).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to terminate/cancel a contract
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 상대 측의 계약 위반으로 인해 계약을 해지하기로 하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Due to the other party's breach of contract, it was decided to terminate the contract.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 해(解) = release. 지(止) = stop. To terminate/cancel contract. Legal dissolution. Related: 해약(cancellation), 종료(termination), 파기(revocation)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to request a review of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 조항에 대한 법률 검토를 요청드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I request a legal review of the relevant clause.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 검토(檢討) - 檢(inspect) + 討(discuss). 요청(要請) - 要(need) + 請(request). Pattern: N에 대한 검토를 요청하다 (request a review of N). Formal administrative request. Related: 요구하다(demand), 심사를 요청하다(request examination).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to go through consultation/deliberation
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 부서와 충분한 협의를 거친 후에 시행하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We will implement it after going through sufficient consultation with the relevant departments.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 협(協) = cooperate. 의(議) = discuss. 거(去) = pass. To go through consultation/deliberation. Procedural requirement. Related: 협의(consultation), 논의(discussion), 합의(consensus)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I ask for your understanding regarding
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 공사로 인한 소음에 대해 양해해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I ask for your understanding regarding the noise from the construction work.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: your esteemed company (honorific in business correspondence)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 귀사의 무궁한 발전을 기원합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We wish for the boundless growth of your esteemed company.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 귀(貴) = precious/honored. 사(社) = company. Your esteemed company. Honorific business correspondence. Related: 귀하(honored you), 존경(respect), 회사(company)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: our humble company (humble form in business correspondence)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 폐사에서는 귀사의 제안을 적극 검토하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Our company will actively review your esteemed company's proposal.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 폐(弊) = worn/humble. 사(社) = company. Our humble company. Self-deprecating business correspondence. Related: 저희(we humble), 겸손(humility), 회사(company)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to fulfill; to carry out; to perform (obligations)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 계약상의 의무를 성실히 이행해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Contractual obligations must be faithfully fulfilled.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 이행(履行) - 履(tread/fulfill) + 行(do). Pattern: N을/를 이행하다 (fulfill N / carry out N). Formal execution of obligations. Related: 수행하다(perform), 실행하다(execute), 지키다(keep).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to not be cost-effective; to not be profitable
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 현재 시장 상황에서는 채산성이 맞지 않아 사업 철수를 검토 중이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given the current market conditions, it is not cost-effective, and we are reviewing withdrawal from the business.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 채(採) = take. 산(算) = calculate. 성(性) = nature. Not cost-effective/profitable. Business viability assessment. Related: 채산(profitability), 수익(profit), 경제성(economic efficiency)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I kindly request a reply regarding
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 견적서에 관해 이번 주 내로 회신 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I kindly request a reply regarding the quotation by the end of this week.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: Formal grammar pattern. Used in written and formal spoken Korean. Common in news reports, academic papers, and official documents. Related: 격식체(formal style), 문어(written language)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to win/receive an order (for a project or contract)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 당사는 해외 인프라 사업을 수주하는 데 성공하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Our company succeeded in winning the overseas infrastructure project order.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 수주(受注) - 受(receive) + 注(order). Pattern: N을/를 수주하다 (win/receive an order for N). Business term for securing contracts. Related: 받다(receive), 계약하다(contract).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to reach the break-even point
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사업 개시 2년 만에 손익분기점에 도달할 것으로 예상됩니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is expected to reach the break-even point two years after the business launch.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 손(損) = loss. 익(益) = profit. 분(分) = divide. 기(岐) = branch. 점(點) = point. To reach break-even point. Financial milestone. Related: 손익(profit/loss), 균형(balance), 수지(balance)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to publicly announce; to make an official notice
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 새로운 환경 규제를 관보에 공고하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government publicly announced the new environmental regulations in the official gazette.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 공고(公告) - 公(public) + 告(announce). Pattern: N을/를 공고하다 (publicly announce N / make an official notice of N). Administrative announcement. Related: 알리다(notify), 발표하다(announce).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue an enforcement decree/executive order
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 개정법에 따른 시행령이 다음 달 발표될 예정이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The enforcement decree under the amended law is scheduled to be issued next month.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 시(施) = implement. 행(行) = carry out. 령(令) = order. 발(發) = issue. 표(表) = express. To issue enforcement decree. Government regulation procedure. Related: 시행(enforcement), 법령(statute), 규정(regulation)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue directives/instructions (from higher to lower government offices)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 중앙 부처에서 각 지방자치단체에 지침을 시달하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The central ministry issued directives to each local government.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 시달(示達) - 示(show) + 達(reach). Pattern: N을/를 시달하다 (issue directives/instructions N). Top-down government directive. Related: 하달하다(issue downward), 지시하다(instruct).

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to impose an administrative sanction/disposition
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위반 업체에 대해 영업 정지 행정 처분을 내렸다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: An administrative sanction of business suspension was imposed on the violating company.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).notes: 행(行) = conduct. 정(政) = government. 처(處) = dispose. 분(分) = divide. To impose administrative sanction. Regulatory enforcement. Related: 행정(administration), 처분(disposition), 제재(sanction)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to have jurisdiction over; to oversee (official authority)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 업무는 환경부가 관장하고 있습니다.
