연어 (Collocations).notes: Establishing position/stability. Related: 자리를 차지하다, 정착하다.

연어 (Collocations).example: 이번 주 내내 야근을 해서 몸이 축나는 게 느껴진다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I've been working overtime all week and I can feel my body wearing down.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Working overtime. Related: 초과 근무, 밤새우다.

연어 (Collocations).example: 더 이상 버틸 수 없어서 결국 사표를 냈다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I couldn't take it anymore, so I finally submitted my resignation.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Submitting resignation. Related: 퇴직하다, 회사를 그만두다.

연어 (Collocations).english: to achieve results; to reap outcomes
연어 (Collocations).example: 6개월간의 노력 끝에 눈에 띄는 성과를 거두었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After six months of effort, we achieved noticeable results.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Achievement/results. Related: 성공을 거두다, 결과를 얻다.

연어 (Collocations).example: 이번에 신입이 들어와서 내가 교육하는 일을 맡게 됐다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: A new hire joined, so I was assigned the task of training them.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Taking on responsibility. Related: 역할을 담당하다, 책임을 지다.

연어 (Collocations).example: 졸업하고 6개월 동안 직장을 구하느라 정신이 없었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: For six months after graduating, I was frantic trying to find a job.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Job hunting. Related: 취업하다, 일자리를 찾다.

연어 (Collocations).english: to gain recognition; to be acknowledged
연어 (Collocations).example: 묵묵히 일한 덕분에 드디어 상사에게 인정을 받았다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Thanks to working quietly and diligently, I was finally recognized by my boss.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Recognition. Related: 평가를 받다, 주목을 받다.

연어 (Collocations).english: to make up for a mistake; to recover from an error
연어 (Collocations).example: 프레젠테이션에서 실수를 했지만 질의응답에서 만회했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I made a mistake during the presentation, but I made up for it during the Q&A.
연어 (Collocations).notes: Error recovery. Related: 실수를 보완하다, 만회하다.

연어 (Collocations).english: to grow apart; for a rift to develop
연어 (Collocations).example: 사소한 오해가 쌓이면서 둘 사이가 점점 벌어졌다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: As small misunderstandings piled up, the two gradually grew apart.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 사(間 between) appears in 사이좋다(close), 틈(gap). 벌(開 open) appears in 벌리다(spread), 간격(interval). Often with 점점, 갈수록.

연어 (Collocations).example: 거래처와 신뢰를 바탕으로 좋은 관계를 맺는 게 중요하다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: It's important to form a good relationship with clients based on trust.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 관(關 relate) appears in 관련(relation), 관여(involvement). 계(係 tie) appears in 인간관계(relationships), 관계자(parties involved). Common with 긴밀한, 새로운.

연어 (Collocations).example: 대학교 동아리에서 인연을 맺은 친구와 아직도 연락하고 지낸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I still keep in touch with a friend I formed a bond with in a college club.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 인(因 cause) appears in 인과(causality), 원인(origin). 연(緣 fate) appears in 연분(destiny), 악연(ill-fated bond). Buddhist concept, often with 소중한.

연어 (Collocations).english: to have a falling out; for a relationship to sour
연어 (Collocations).example: 돈 문제로 10년 지기 친구와 사이가 틀어졌다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I had a falling out with a friend of ten years over a money issue.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 틀(乖 go wrong) appears in 어긋나다(go astray). 사이(間 between) pairs with 멀어지다(grow distant), 나빠지다(worsen). Often with 완전히, 심하게.

연어 (Collocations).english: to open one's heart; to let someone in
연어 (Collocations).example: 처음에는 경계했지만 시간이 지나면서 서서히 마음을 열었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: At first I was guarded, but as time passed I gradually opened my heart.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 마(心 heart/mind) in native form. Pairs with 문을 열다(open door). Common with 조금씩, 서서히, 상대방에게.

연어 (Collocations).example: 헤어진 뒤로 깔끔하게 연락을 끊었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After the breakup, I cut off contact cleanly.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 연(連 connect) appears in 연결(connection), 연속(continuity). 락(絡 link) appears in 낙하(fall), 통신망(network). Common with 완전히, 일방적으로.

연어 (Collocations).example: 아무리 사소해도 약속을 지키는 사람이 진짜 믿을 만하다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: A person who keeps promises, no matter how small, is truly trustworthy.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 약(約 promise) appears in 조약(treaty), 약정(agreement). 속(束 bind) appears in 제약(restriction), 구속(restraint). Common with 반드시, 꼭.

연어 (Collocations).example: 직접 만나서 이야기하니까 금방 오해를 풀 수 있었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Once we met in person and talked, we were able to clear up the misunderstanding quickly.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 오(誤 error) appears in 오류(mistake), 착오(misunderstanding). 해(解 understand) appears in 이해(understanding), 해석(interpretation). Common with 제대로, 빨리.

연어 (Collocations).example: 신뢰를 쌓는 데는 오래 걸리지만 무너지는 건 한순간이다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Building trust takes a long time, but it can crumble in an instant.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 신(信 trust) appears in 신용(credit), 믿음(belief). 뢰(賴 rely) appears in 의뢰(request), 신임(confidence). Common with 차근차근, 오랜 시간.

연어 (Collocations).example: 고향에 계신 부모님께 합격 소식을 전하니 많이 기뻐하셨다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: When I shared the news of my acceptance with my parents back home, they were overjoyed.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 소(消 vanish/news) appears in 소문(rumor), 소리(sound). 식(息 breath/news) appears in 음식(food), 자식(child). Common with 좋은, 반가운, 급히.

연어 (Collocations).example: 교수님이 국제 학회에서 논문을 발표하고 큰 주목을 받았다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The professor presented a paper at an international conference and received a lot of attention.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 논(論 discuss) appears in 논리(logic), 결론(conclusion). 문(文 writing) appears in 문서(document), 문장(sentence). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 실험에 앞서 먼저 명확한 가설을 세우는 것이 중요하다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: It's important to formulate a clear hypothesis before conducting the experiment.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 가(假 temporary) appears in 가정(assumption), 휴가(vacation). 설(說 theory) appears in 학설(academic theory), 설명(explanation). Scientific register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 석사 논문을 위해 6개월간 현장에서 자료를 수집했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I spent six months collecting data in the field for my master's thesis.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 자(資 capital) appears in 자금(funds), 물자(resources). 료(料 material) appears in 재료(materials), 연료(fuel). Common with 체계적으로, 광범위하게.

연어 (Collocations).example: 설문 결과를 토대로 통계 분석을 실시한 결과 유의미한 차이가 나타났다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After conducting a statistical analysis based on the survey results, a significant difference was found.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 분(分 divide) appears in 분리(separation), 구분(distinction). 석(析 analyze) appears in 해석(interpretation), 분해(decomposition). Formal/academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 다양한 변수를 고려하여 신뢰할 수 있는 결과를 도출해야 한다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: We need to derive reliable results by considering various variables.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 결(結 tie) appears in 결론(conclusion), 결정(decision). 과(果 result) appears in 성과(achievement), 효과(effect). Academic/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 이 팀은 인공지능의 윤리적 문제에 대해 3년간 연구를 수행해 왔다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: This team has been conducting research on the ethical issues of AI for three years.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 연(研 grind) appears in 연마(polish), 연습(practice). 구(究 investigate) appears in 탐구(exploration), 연구소(research institute). Formal/academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 수십 년간의 연구 끝에 새로운 학문적 이론을 정립하는 데 성공했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After decades of research, they succeeded in establishing a new academic theory.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 이(理 reason) appears in 이성(reason), 원리(principle). 론(論 theory) appears in 논리(logic), 의론(discussion). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 주장만 하지 말고 구체적인 근거를 제시해 주세요.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Don't just make claims — please present concrete evidence.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 근(根 root) appears in 뿌리(root), 근본(foundation). 거(據 base) appears in 증거(evidence), 의거(reliance). Academic/legal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 직장을 다니면서 야간 대학원에서 석사 학위를 취득했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I earned my master's degree from an evening graduate program while working.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 학(學 study) appears in 학교(school), 과학(science). 위(位 position) appears in 지위(status), 위치(position). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).english: to organize/summarize the key points of argument
연어 (Collocations).example: 회의가 길어지니까 한 번 논점을 정리하고 넘어가자.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The meeting is dragging on, so let's organize the key points and move on.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 논(論 discuss) appears in 논리(logic), 토론(debate). 점(點 point) appears in 요점(key point), 관점(viewpoint). Academic/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 정부는 정책을 시행하기 전에 충분히 여론을 수렴해야 한다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The government should sufficiently gather public opinion before implementing the policy.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 여(輿 public) appears in 여론조사(poll). 론(論 opinion) appears in 논의(discussion), 의론(opinion). Political/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 여야 합의 끝에 해당 법안을 통과시키는 데 성공했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After bipartisan agreement, they succeeded in passing the bill.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 법(法 law) appears in 법률(legislation), 방법(method). 안(案 plan) appears in 제안(proposal), 방안(plan). Political/legal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 외교부가 긴급 성명을 발표하며 강력히 항의했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs issued an emergency statement and protested strongly.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 성(聲 voice) appears in 음성(voice), 성원(support). 명(明 clear) appears in 명확(clear), 설명(explanation). Formal/political register.

연어 (Collocations).english: to be charged with; to be under suspicion of
연어 (Collocations).example: 그는 횡령 혐의를 받고 현재 검찰 조사를 받고 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: He is under suspicion of embezzlement and is currently being investigated by prosecutors.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 혐(嫌 suspicion) appears in 혐오(hatred), 기피(avoidance). 의(疑 doubt) appears in 의심(suspicion), 의문(question). Legal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 장관의 발언이 큰 논란을 일으키면서 사퇴 요구가 빗발쳤다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The minister's remarks stirred up major controversy, prompting a flood of calls for resignation.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 논(論 discuss) appears in 토론(debate), 논쟁(controversy). 란(亂 disorder) appears in 혼란(confusion), 분란(disturbance). Media/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 양측이 밤새 협상한 끝에 드디어 합의를 이루었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After negotiating through the night, both sides finally reached an agreement.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 합(合 join) appears in 결합(union), 통합(integration). 의(議 discuss) appears in 회의(meeting), 의논(discussion). Political/business register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 국제 사회가 핵 개발에 대해 강력한 제재를 가하기로 결정했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The international community decided to impose strong sanctions on nuclear development.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 제(制 control) appears in 통제(control), 제한(restriction). 재(裁 cut) appears in 재판(trial), 결재(approval). Political/legal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 경찰이 내부 제보를 받고 즉시 수사에 착수했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The police received an internal tip and immediately launched an investigation.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 수(搜 search) appears in 검색(search), 수색(search). 사(査 investigate) appears in 조사(investigation), 검사(inspection). Legal/police register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 태풍으로 해안 지역 주민들이 큰 피해를 입었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Residents of coastal areas suffered significant damage from the typhoon.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 피(被 suffer) appears in 피난(refuge), 피의자(suspect). 해(害 harm) appears in 손해(damage), 해로움(harmfulness). Legal/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 회사 측은 기자회견에서 이번 사건에 대한 공식 입장을 밝혔다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The company stated its official position on the incident at the press conference.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 입(立 stand) appears in 독립(independence), 설립(establishment). 장(場 place) appears in 현장(scene), 시장(market). Political/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).english: to have a restless night; to sleep fitfully
연어 (Collocations).example: 내일 면접 생각에 밤새 잠을 설쳤다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I had a restless night thinking about tomorrow's interview.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 잠(寢 sleep) in native form. Expresses restless sleep due to worry/excitement. Common with 밤새, 많이, 요즘.

연어 (Collocations).example: 결혼하고 처음으로 둘이서 살림을 꾸리는 게 쉽지 않았다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Setting up a household together for the first time after getting married wasn't easy.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 살림 means household, from 살다(live). 꾸리다 means to manage/organize. Common with 알뜰하게, 혼자, 신혼.

연어 (Collocations).english: to nag; to lecture someone repeatedly
연어 (Collocations).example: 엄마가 매일 방 정리하라고 잔소리를 하셔서 귀가 아프다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: My mom nags me every day to clean my room — my ears are ringing.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 잔(殘 remain) appears in 잔여(remainder), 찌꺼기(residue). 소(小 small) appears in 소형(small size). Nagging/lecturing, often with 자꾸, 계속.

연어 (Collocations).english: to get some fresh air; to step outside for air
연어 (Collocations).example: 머리가 복잡할 때는 밖에 나가서 바람을 쐬는 게 최고다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: When my head is full of thoughts, the best thing to do is go outside and get some fresh air.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 바람 means wind/air (native Korean). 쐬다 means to be exposed to. Common with 밖에 나가서, 잠깐.

연어 (Collocations).english: to treat someone to a meal/drinks
연어 (Collocations).example: 승진 축하한다! 오늘 한턱 내는 거지?
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Congratulations on the promotion! You're treating us today, right?
연어 (Collocations).notes: 턱 means meal/treat (native Korean). 한 means one. Common with 크게, 오늘, 제가.

연어 (Collocations).example: 출장 전날 밤에 허겁지겁 짐을 꾸렸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I hurriedly packed my bags the night before the business trip.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 짐 means luggage/burden (native Korean). 꾸리다 means to pack. Common with 서둘러, 여행, 이사.

연어 (Collocations).english: to get one's appetite back; to feel hungry again
연어 (Collocations).example: 며칠째 아팠는데 오늘은 좀 나아져서 입맛이 돈다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I was sick for days, but today I feel a bit better and my appetite is coming back.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 입맛 means appetite (native Korean). 돌다 means to return/come back. Common with 다시, 조금씩.

연어 (Collocations).example: 학자금 대출 빚을 갚는 데만 5년이 걸렸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: It took five years just to pay off my student loan debt.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 빚 means debt (native Korean). 갚다 means to repay. Common with 모두, 빨리, 천천히.

연어 (Collocations).example: 사소한 일상에도 의미를 부여하면 삶이 더 풍요로워진다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: If you attach meaning even to trivial everyday moments, life becomes richer.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 의(意 meaning) appears in 의도(intention), 뜻(meaning). 미(味 taste/meaning) appears in 흥미(interest), 맛(taste). Formal/academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 기존 시스템이 급격한 수요 증가에 한계를 드러냈다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The existing system revealed its limits in the face of a rapid surge in demand.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 한(限 limit) appears in 제한(restriction), 무한(infinite). 계(界 boundary) appears in 경계(border), 세계(world). Common with 명확히, 분명히.

연어 (Collocations).example: 일과 삶의 균형을 유지하는 것이 요즘 직장인의 최대 과제다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Maintaining a work-life balance is the biggest challenge for today's office workers.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 균(均 equal) appears in 평균(average), 고르다(even). 형(衡 balance) appears in 평형(equilibrium), 저울(scale). Formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 겉모습에 속지 말고 문제의 본질을 파악하는 것이 중요하다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Don't be fooled by appearances — it's important to grasp the essence of the problem.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 본(本 origin) appears in 기본(foundation), 근본(root). 질(質 substance) appears in 성질(property), 물질(matter). Academic/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 어린 시절의 경험이 성인이 된 후에도 큰 영향을 미친다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Childhood experiences have a significant influence even into adulthood.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 영(影 shadow) appears in 그림자(shadow), 투영(projection). 향(響 echo) appears in 반향(response), 음향(sound). Common with 크게, 직접적으로.

연어 (Collocations).example: 매출이 계속 떨어지자 경영진이 구조적인 변화를 꾀했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: As sales kept declining, the management sought structural changes.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 변(變 change) appears in 개변(alteration), 변동(fluctuation). 화(化 transform) appears in 문화(culture), 진화(evolution). Formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 국민의 기대에 부응하는 정책을 만들어야 한다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: We must create policies that live up to the people's expectations.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 기(期 period) appears in 시기(time), 기한(deadline). 대(待 wait) appears in 대기(waiting), 기다림(waiting). Formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 세대 간 가치관 차이가 가정 내에서 갈등을 빚는 경우가 많다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Differences in values between generations often cause conflict within families.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 갈(葛 arrowroot) appears in 갈등(conflict). 등(藤 wisteria) appears together only in 갈등. Common with 심각한, 끊임없이.

연어 (Collocations).example: 주변 압력에도 불구하고 끝까지 소신을 지킨 그녀가 대단하다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: It's impressive that she stuck to her convictions to the end despite the pressure around her.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 소(所 place) appears in 장소(place), 주소(address). 신(信 belief) appears in 신념(conviction), 믿음(faith). Common with 끝까지, 자신의.

연어 (Collocations).example: 그동안 과소평가되었던 전통 공예의 가치를 인정하는 움직임이 커지고 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: There is a growing movement to recognize the value of traditional crafts that have long been undervalued.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 가(價 value) appears in 가격(price), 평가(evaluation). 치(値 worth) appears in 값(price), 대가(cost). Formal/academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 저자는 서론에서 핵심 논지를 펼치고 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The author develops the core argument in the introduction.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 논(論 argue) appears in 논리(logic), 토론(debate). 지(旨 purport) appears in 취지(purpose), 요지(gist). Academic/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 관련 문헌을 검토한 결과 선행 연구와 일치하는 결과를 얻었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After reviewing the relevant literature, we obtained results consistent with prior research.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 문(文 writing) appears in 문서(document), 문장(sentence). 헌(獻 offer) appears in 공헌(contribution), 헌신(dedication). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 보고서에서는 최근 통계를 인용하여 주장을 뒷받침했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The report cited recent statistics to support the argument.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 통(統 govern) appears in 통제(control), 전통(tradition). 계(計 count) appears in 계산(calculation), 회계(accounting). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 이 발견은 기존 학설을 뒤집을 만큼 획기적이다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: This discovery is groundbreaking enough to overturn existing theories.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 학(學 study) appears in 학문(scholarship), 과학(science). 설(說 theory) appears in 가설(hypothesis), 설명(explanation). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 연구 결과로부터 정책적 시사점을 도출할 수 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Policy implications can be derived from the research findings.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 시(示 show) appears in 전시(exhibition), 지시(instruction). 사(唆 incite) appears in 교사(instigation), 암시(hint). Academic/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 글의 전후 맥락을 파악해야 정확한 해석이 가능하다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: You need to grasp the context before and after to interpret it accurately.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 맥(脈 vein) appears in 혈맥(bloodline), 문맥(context). 락(絡 connect) appears in 연락(contact), 낙하(fall). Academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 사회 변화에 대한 새로운 담론을 형성할 필요가 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: There is a need to form a new discourse on social change.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 담(談 talk) appears in 대담(interview), 회담(talks). 론(論 discuss) appears in 논리(logic), 토론(debate). Academic/intellectual register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 연구의 범위를 한정하지 않으면 논문이 산만해진다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: If you don't limit the scope of the research, the paper becomes unfocused.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 범(範 limit) appears in 모범(model), 규범(norm). 위(圍 surround) appears in 주위(surroundings), 포위(siege). Academic/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).english: to highlight an issue/point of contention
연어 (Collocations).example: 토론자는 핵심 쟁점을 부각하며 청중의 관심을 끌었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The debater drew the audience's attention by highlighting the key issue.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 쟁(爭 dispute) appears in 전쟁(war), 논쟁(dispute). 점(點 point) appears in 요점(main point), 관점(viewpoint). Media/academic register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 상대측이 강력한 반론을 제기하여 논쟁이 격화되었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The opposing side raised a strong counterargument, intensifying the debate.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 반(反 oppose) appears in 반대(opposition), 반응(reaction). 론(論 argument) appears in 논리(logic), 의론(opinion). Academic/debate register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 장관의 발언이 알려지면서 파문이 빠르게 확산되었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: As the minister's remarks became known, the controversy spread rapidly.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 파(波 wave) appears in 파도(wave), 음파(sound wave). 문(紋 pattern) appears in 지문(fingerprint), 문양(pattern). Media register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 정부의 미온적 대응으로 사태가 악화되고 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The situation is worsening due to the government's lukewarm response.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 사(事 matter) appears in 일(work), 사건(incident). 태(態 state) appears in 상태(condition), 태도(attitude). News/formal register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 검찰은 비리 의혹에 대한 수사를 확대하기로 했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The prosecution decided to expand the investigation into corruption allegations.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 수(搜 search) appears in 수색(search), 탐색(exploration). 사(査 investigate) appears in 조사(investigation), 검사(inspection). Legal/police register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 대통령의 담화 이후 정치 국면이 전환되었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The political situation shifted after the president's address.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 국(局 situation) appears in 결국(finally), 국가(nation). 면(面 aspect) appears in 측면(aspect), 표면(surface). Political/media register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 적국이 군사적 보복을 감행할 가능성이 높다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: There is a high possibility the enemy nation will carry out military retaliation.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 보(報 report) appears in 신문(newspaper), 보답(repayment). 복(復 return) appears in 회복(recovery), 복귀(return). Political/military register.

연어 (Collocations).english: for public sentiment to turn away
연어 (Collocations).example: 잇따른 실정으로 민심이 이반되고 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Public sentiment is turning away due to successive policy failures.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 민(民 people) appears in 국민(citizens), 인민(people). 심(心 heart) appears in 마음(heart), 중심(center). Political register.

연어 (Collocations).english: for the political situation to become deadlocked
연어 (Collocations).example: 여야 간 대립으로 정국이 경색되었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The political situation became deadlocked due to the conflict between ruling and opposition parties.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 정(政 politics) appears in 정치(politics), 행정(administration). 국(局 situation) appears in 국면(phase), 결국(finally). Political register.

연어 (Collocations).english: for an emergency to be declared
연어 (Collocations).example: 집중호우 경보로 전국에 비상이 걸렸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: An emergency was declared nationwide due to heavy rain warnings.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 비(非 not) appears in 비정상(abnormal), 비밀(secret). 상(常 usual) appears in 일상(daily), 평상시(normal times). Emergency register.

연어 (Collocations).english: to become the subject of gossip/controversy
연어 (Collocations).example: 유명 연예인이 사생활 문제로 구설수에 올랐다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: A famous celebrity became the subject of controversy over a personal life issue.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 구(口 mouth) appears in 구두(oral), 인구(population). 설(舌 tongue) appears in 설명(explanation), 혀(tongue). Means to become subject of gossip.

연어 (Collocations).example: 시민단체가 유사 사고의 재발 방지를 촉구했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Civic groups urged the prevention of similar accidents recurring.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 재(再 again) appears in 재차(again), 다시(again). 발(發 emit) appears in 발생(occurrence), 출발(departure). Formal/media register.

연어 (Collocations).example: 말다툼이 길어지면서 감정이 격해졌다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: As the argument dragged on, emotions became heated.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 감(感 feel) appears in 감각(sensation), 느낌(feeling). 정(情 emotion) appears in 열정(passion), 정서(emotion). Common with 점점, 갑자기.

연어 (Collocations).example: 그의 진심 어린 사과에 마음이 동했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I was moved by his sincere apology.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 마음 means heart/mind (native Korean). 동(動 move) appears in 이동(movement), 운동(motion). Common with 조금, 크게.

연어 (Collocations).example: 반복되는 불공정에 시민들의 분노가 폭발했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Citizens' anger erupted over repeated unfairness.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 분(憤 anger) appears in 분개(indignation), 억울함(injustice). 노(怒 rage) appears in 노여움(anger), 화(anger). Common with 순간, 억눌린.

연어 (Collocations).example: 매번 같은 결과가 반복되니 회의감이 든다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The same results keep repeating, so I feel skepticism.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 회(懷 harbor) appears in 회포(feelings), 품다(embrace). 의(疑 doubt) appears in 의심(suspicion), 의문(question). Common with 점점, 깊은.

연어 (Collocations).example: 함께 지낸 시간이 길어질수록 정이 깊어졌다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The longer we spent together, the deeper our attachment grew.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 정(情 affection) appears in 감정(emotion), 열정(passion), 인정(human warmth). Native concept of attachment. Common with 점점, 서서히.

연어 (Collocations).example: 헤어졌지만 아직 미련이 남아 있다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: We broke up, but I still have lingering feelings.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 미(未 not yet) appears in 미완성(incomplete), 아직(yet). 련(練 refine) appears in 수련(training), 연습(practice). Common with 아직도, 조금.

연어 (Collocations).example: 가장 가까운 사람에게 상처를 받으면 더 아프다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: It hurts more when you're hurt by someone closest to you.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 상(傷 wound) appears in 부상(injury), 외상(trauma). 처(處 place) appears in 처음(beginning), 장소(place). Emotional wounds, common with 깊은, 마음에.

연어 (Collocations).example: 몇 번이나 실패한 끝에 체념에 빠졌다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: After failing several times, I fell into resignation.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 체(諦 give up) appears in 단념(abandonment), 포기(giving up). 념(念 thought) appears in 관념(concept), 생각(thought). Common with 완전히, 깊은.

연어 (Collocations).example: 그 사건 이후로 줄곧 죄의식에 시달렸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I was tormented by guilt ever since that incident.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 죄(罪 crime) appears in 범죄(crime), 유죄(guilty). 의(意 意 意) appears in 의도(intention), 뜻(meaning). Common with 계속, 심한.

연어 (Collocations).english: for love and hate to intertwine
연어 (Collocations).example: 가족이라는 관계 속에서 애증이 교차한다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Love and hate intertwine within the bonds of family.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 애(愛 love) appears in 사랑(love), 연애(romance). 증(憎 hate) appears in 증오(hatred), 미움(hatred). Common with 복잡한, 미묘한.

연어 (Collocations).example: 결승선을 통과한 순간 주먹을 불끈 쥐었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The moment I crossed the finish line, I clenched my fist tightly.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 주먹 means fist (native Korean). 불끈 is onomatopoeia for gripping tightly. Shows determination or anger. Common with 힘껏, 분노로.

연어 (Collocations).example: 부상이 걱정되어 몸을 사리며 경기에 임했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Worried about injury, I played the match while holding back.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 몸 means body (native Korean). 사리다 means to hold back/protect. Common with 위험할 때, 조심스럽게.

연어 (Collocations).example: 가파른 산길을 오르느라 숨을 헐떡였다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I was panting after climbing the steep mountain path.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 숨 means breath (native Korean). 헐떡이다 is onomatopoeia for panting. Common with 거칠게, 심하게.

연어 (Collocations).example: 한여름 공사 현장에서 땀을 뻘뻘 흘렸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I was sweating profusely at the construction site in midsummer.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 땀 means sweat (native Korean). 뻘뻘 is onomatopoeia for profuse sweating. Common with 더워서, 긴장해서.

연어 (Collocations).english: for one's body to stiffen/freeze up
연어 (Collocations).example: 무대 위에 올라가자마자 긴장해서 몸이 굳었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: As soon as I got on stage, I froze up from nerves.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 몸 means body (native Korean). 굳다 means to stiffen/harden. From fear or cold. Common with 공포로, 추위에.

연어 (Collocations).example: 아버지가 눈을 부릅뜨고 아이를 꾸짖었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: The father glared wide-eyed and scolded the child.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 눈 means eyes (native Korean). 부릅뜨다 means to glare wide-eyed. Shows anger or intensity. Common with 화나서, 크게.

연어 (Collocations).example: 찬바람에 어깨를 움츠리며 걸었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I walked hunching my shoulders against the cold wind.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 어깨 means shoulders (native Korean). 움츠리다 means to hunch/shrink. From cold or fear. Common with 추위에, 무서워서.

연어 (Collocations).english: to straighten one's back; to finally relax after hardship
연어 (Collocations).example: 빚을 다 갚고 나서야 허리를 펼 수 있었다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: Only after paying off all the debt could I finally straighten my back.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 허리 means back/waist (native Korean). 펴다 means to straighten. Literal and metaphorical (relief from hardship). Common with 드디어, 이제.

연어 (Collocations).example: 약속 시간이 다가오자 발걸음을 재촉했다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: As the appointment time approached, I quickened my pace.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 발걸음 means pace/steps (native Korean). 재(催 urge) appears in 촉구(urging), 독촉(pressing). Common with 서둘러, 빨리.

연어 (Collocations).english: to grit one's teeth (in determination or endurance)
연어 (Collocations).example: 고통을 참으며 이를 악물고 달렸다.
연어 (Collocations).example_en: I gritted my teeth and ran, enduring the pain.
연어 (Collocations).notes: 이 means teeth (native Korean). 악(齶 palate) appears in 상악(upper jaw). Shows determination or endurance. Common with 힘껏, 고통을 참으며.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Expression of shock or disbelief, like 'whoa' or 'oh my god.' Used when something unexpected or absurd happens.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 헐, 걔가 회사 그만뒀다고? 입사한 지 일주일밖에 안 됐잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Whoa, he quit the company? It's only been a week since he started.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Shock/disbelief exclamation. Younger generation, casual. Related: 정말?, 진짜?.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Versatile exclamation expressing frustration, exhaustion, sympathy, or mild pain. Used across all ages and situations.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아이고, 허리야. 하루 종일 앉아 있었더니 온몸이 쑤셔.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Oh my, my back. I've been sitting all day and my whole body aches.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Versatile exclamation for frustration/pain/sympathy. Cross-generational. Related: 아이고머니, 아유.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Exclamation of surprise (slightly feminine). Used for unexpected discoveries or mild shock.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어머, 이게 누구야! 여기서 만날 줄이야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Oh my, who is this! I never expected to run into you here.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Surprise (slightly feminine). Related: 어머나, 오마이갓.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Good heavens' or 'oh my goodness.' Expresses strong surprise or disbelief at something remarkable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 세상에, 십 년 만에 연락이 오다니. 너무 반갑다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Good heavens, getting a call after ten years. I'm so glad to hear from you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Strong surprise. Related: 세상에 다신, 천만의 말씀.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's absurd' or 'no way.' Used when something seems impossible or unbelievable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 식당 웨이팅이 세 시간이래. 말도 안 돼, 그냥 다른 데 가자.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They say the wait at that restaurant is three hours. That's absurd, let's just go somewhere else.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Expressing absurdity. Related: 그럴 리가, 웬일이야.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'What brings you here?' or 'what a rare occasion.' Used when someone does something unexpected or out of character.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 네가 아침에 일찍 일어나다니, 웬일이야? 무슨 일 있어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You're up early in the morning — what's the occasion? Is something going on?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Asking what's the occasion. Related: 뭐 하는 거야?, 왜 그래?

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That can't be' or 'no way.' Expresses disbelief or denial that something is true.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험에 떨어졌다고? 그럴 리가. 네가 얼마나 열심히 했는데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You failed the exam? That can't be. You worked so hard for it.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Disbelief. Related: 말도 안 돼, 있을 수 없지.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'How can it be like this?' Expresses admiration, surprise, or sometimes frustration at an extreme quality.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어쩜 이렇게 맛있지? 이 집 비빔밥은 진짜 예술이다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: How can it be this good? The bibimbap here is truly a work of art.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Expressing amazement. Related: 어떻게 이럴 수 있어, 정말 대단해.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'What is this?' Reaction of confusion, disgust, or disbelief at something right in front of you.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 뭐야 이게, 택배가 완전히 찌그러져서 왔네. 항의해야겠다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: What is this — the package arrived completely crushed. I need to file a complaint.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Confusion/disgust. Related: 이게 뭐 하는 거야?, 이건 너무해.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm dumbfounded' or 'I can't believe this.' Stronger than simple surprise; implies the situation is absurd or outrageous.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 줄 서 있었는데 새치기를 하더라. 진짜 어이가 없어서 말이 안 나왔어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was standing in line and someone cut in front of me. I was so dumbfounded I couldn't even speak.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Dumbfounded. Related: 황당하다, 코웃음이 나오다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Euphemistic way to say something is uncomfortable, awkward, or not great. Used to soften refusals or negative opinions.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 날 약속은 좀 그런데, 다른 날은 안 될까?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That day is a bit difficult for me — would another day work?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean hedging expression. Casual register. More polite than direct criticism. Formal: 적절하지 않다, 문제가 있다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Hmm, well...' or 'I'm not so sure.' Non-committal response when you don't want to give a definite answer.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이번 프로젝트 성공할 수 있을까요?" "글쎄요, 아직 변수가 많아서 뭐라 말하기 어렵네요."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Do you think this project can succeed?" "Well... there are still a lot of variables, so it's hard to say."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean filler. Casual/polite. Non-committal response. Formal: 잘 모르겠습니다, 확실하지 않습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's true, but...' Acknowledges someone's point while signaling disagreement or a reservation is coming.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그렇긴 한데, 현실적으로 그게 가능할까? 예산도 부족하잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That's true, but is it realistically possible? We don't even have the budget.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean connector. Casual. Acknowledges then counters. Formal: 그것은 사실이나, 동의하기는 하지만.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'This might sound weird/rude, but...' Preface before saying something potentially awkward or blunt.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 말이 좀 그런데, 그 사람이랑 같이 일하기 좀 힘들지 않아?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This might sound a bit off, but isn't it kind of hard working with that person?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean hedging phrase. Casual. Softens potentially rude statement. Formal: 이렇게 말씀드리기 조심스러운데.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Depending on how you look at it' or 'in a way.' Used to offer an alternative perspective or soften a statement.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어떻게 보면 오히려 잘된 거야. 그 회사 얼마 후에 망했잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: In a way, it actually worked out for the better. That company went under not long after.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 보(見 see) from 보다(to see). Casual/neutral. Offers alternative perspective. Formal: 관점에 따라서는, 일면으로는.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Well, I suppose that's possible' or 'that can happen.' Casual acceptance or concession, sometimes reluctant.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 실수한 거에 대해 사과했대. 뭐 그럴 수도 있지, 누구나 실수하니까.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: He said he apologized for the mistake. Well, that can happen — everyone makes mistakes.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Reluctant concession. Formal: 그럴 가능성도 있습니다, 충분히 그럴 수 있습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'To be honest' or 'frankly speaking.' Used before delivering a candid opinion, often one the listener might not want to hear.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 솔직히 말하면 나도 별로 기대 안 했는데, 의외로 재밌더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: To be honest, I wasn't expecting much either, but it was surprisingly fun.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 솔(率 straightforward) appears in 경솔(rashness). 직(直 straight) appears in 정직(honesty). Casual/neutral. Formal: 솔직하게 말씀드리자면.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'The way I see it' or 'in my opinion.' Introduces a personal assessment, slightly hedged to avoid sounding too assertive.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 보기엔 아직 준비가 덜 된 것 같아. 조금 더 다듬는 게 어때?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The way I see it, it doesn't seem quite ready yet. How about polishing it a bit more?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 보(見 see) from 보다. Casual. Personal opinion marker. Formal: 제가 보기에는, 저의 견해로는.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'For no good reason' or 'unnecessarily.' Expresses regret about a pointless action or an inexplicable feeling.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 괜히 말했나 봐. 분위기가 갑자기 어색해졌어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I guess I shouldn't have said anything. The mood suddenly got awkward.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean adverb. Casual. Expresses regret about pointless action. Formal: 쓸데없이, 필요 없이, 공연히.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's a bit awkward to say this, but...' Polite preface before saying something delicate or potentially unwelcome.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 말하기 좀 뭐하지만, 네 발표 자료에 오타가 좀 많아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It's a bit awkward to say this, but there are quite a few typos in your presentation materials.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean hedging. Casual/polite. Before delicate statement. Formal: 말씀드리기 조심스럽지만, 송구스럽지만.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm dying (of...).' Hyperbolic suffix expressing an extreme state — hunger, tiredness, boredom, heat, etc.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 배고파 죽겠다. 점심 안 먹었더니 정말 쓰러질 것 같아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I'm starving to death. I skipped lunch and I feel like I'm going to collapse.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 죽(死 die) from 죽다. Casual/slang. Hyperbolic extreme state. Formal: 너무 ~하다, 매우 ~하다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's no joke' or 'it's seriously intense.' Emphasizes that something is extreme in degree — positively or negatively.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 오늘 추위 장난 아니다. 나가자마자 후회했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The cold today is no joke. I regretted it the moment I stepped outside.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 장난 means joke/play (native Korean). Casual/slang. Emphasizes extremity. Formal: 대단하다, 심각하다, 엄청나다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's driving me crazy.' Expresses overwhelming frustration, stress, or sometimes excitement.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 옆집에서 새벽 두 시까지 노래를 불러. 미치겠다, 진짜.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The neighbors are singing until 2 AM. It's driving me insane, honestly.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 미치다 means to go crazy (native Korean). Casual/slang. Overwhelming feeling. Formal: 견디기 힘들다, 감당하기 어렵다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's amazing' or 'unbeatable.' Strong compliment meaning something is exceptionally good.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 집 갈비탕 끝내준다. 여기 자주 와야겠다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The galbitang here is incredible. I should come here more often.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/slang. Strong positive compliment. Formal: 훌륭하다, 뛰어나다, 매우 좋다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's not just once or twice.' Emphasizes that something has happened repeatedly, implying frustration or a pattern.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 사람이 약속을 어긴 게 한두 번이 아니야. 이제 못 믿겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It's not just once or twice that he's broken promises. I can't trust him anymore.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean counting. Casual. Emphasizes repetition. Formal: 여러 번이다, 반복적이다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Does that even make sense?' Rhetorical question expressing that something is completely unreasonable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 월급은 그대로인데 일만 두 배로 늘었어. 이게 말이 되냐?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: My salary is the same but the workload doubled. Does that even make sense?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean rhetorical question. Casual/confrontational. Questions reasonableness. Formal: 그것이 합리적입니까, 타당합니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You have no idea how much...' Emphasizes an extreme degree of something that's hard to convey.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 소식 듣고 얼마나 기뻤는지 몰라. 눈물이 날 뻔했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You have no idea how happy I was to hear that news. I almost cried.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean pattern. Casual/neutral. Emphasizes extreme degree. Formal: 매우 ~하다, 상당히 ~하다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm overwhelmed' or 'I can't think straight.' Describes being so busy or chaotic that you lose track of things.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이사 준비하느라 요즘 정신이 없어. 뭐가 어디 있는지도 모르겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I've been so overwhelmed preparing for the move. I don't even know where anything is.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 정(精 essence) appears in 정력(energy), 열정(passion). 신(神 spirit) appears in 신경(nerves). Casual. Formal: 매우 바쁘다, 혼란스럽다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Why is there so much of this?' Exclamation of exasperation at an excessive quantity of something.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 서류가 뭐가 이렇게 많아, 이걸 언제 다 처리해?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Why is there so much paperwork? When am I supposed to get through all of this?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean complaint. Casual. Exasperation at quantity. Formal: 왜 이렇게 많습니까, 양이 과도합니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's not just...' / 'And that's not even the only thing.' Rhetorical expression meaning the problem goes far beyond what was mentioned.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 돈 문제가 어디 그것뿐이겠어. 시간도 없고 사람도 부족해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The money issue is not even the half of it. There's no time and not enough people either.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean rhetorical. Casual. Problem goes beyond stated issue. Formal: 그것만이 아니다, 다른 문제도 있다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You know what' or 'so listen.' Conversation opener to get someone's attention before introducing a topic.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 있잖아, 나 요즘 고민이 하나 있는데 얘기 좀 해도 돼?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Hey, so listen — I've been worried about something lately. Can I talk to you about it?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean attention-getter. Casual/intimate. Conversation opener. Formal: 저기요, 말씀 좀 드려도 될까요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Exactly' or 'that's what I'm saying.' Used to strongly agree with someone, or as a filler meaning 'so' or 'I mean.'
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이번 일은 좀 심하지 않아?" "그러니까, 나도 그 말을 하고 싶었어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Isn't this going a bit too far?" "Exactly — that's what I wanted to say."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean connector. Casual/neutral. Agreement or explanation. Formal: 바로 그것입니다, 즉, 그러므로.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Oh right' or 'that reminds me.' Used when you suddenly remember something mid-conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아 맞다, 내일 회의 시간 바뀐 거 알지? 두 시로 옮겨졌어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Oh right, you know the meeting time changed tomorrow, right? It moved to 2 o'clock.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean exclamation. Casual. Sudden remembering. Formal: 그것이 생각났습니다, 잠깐만요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's not what I mean' or 'no, actually.' Used to correct a misunderstanding or redirect the conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그게 아니라, 내 말은 아예 안 된다는 게 아니고 좀 더 생각해 보자는 거야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That's not what I mean — I'm not saying it's impossible, I'm saying let's think about it more.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean correction. Casual/neutral. Corrects misunderstanding. Formal: 그것이 아니고, 제 말씀은.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'How should I put it' or 'what's the word.' Filler used while searching for the right expression.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 영화가, 뭐랄까, 슬프면서도 따뜻한 느낌이었어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That movie was, how should I put it, sad but warm at the same time.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean filler. Casual. Searching for words. Formal: 어떻게 표현하면 좋을까요, 즉.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That aside' or 'anyway.' Used to acknowledge a point then shift to a different topic.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그건 그렇고, 주말에 시간 있어? 같이 밥 먹자.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That aside, are you free this weekend? Let's grab a meal.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean transition. Casual/neutral. Acknowledges then shifts topic. Formal: 그것은 그렇다 치고, 한편.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'By the way' or 'anyway' (topic pivot). Used to change the subject naturally in casual conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그나저나 너 요즘 운동 시작했다며? 몸이 달라진 것 같은데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: By the way, I heard you started working out recently? You look like you've changed.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean topic changer. Casual. Natural pivot. Formal: 그런데, 한편, 다른 이야기지만.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Come to think of it' or 'well, you have a point.' Concedes that the other person's argument is valid after initial resistance.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 하긴, 네 말도 맞아. 서두르면 오히려 실수할 수 있지.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Come to think of it, you're right. If we rush, we might make mistakes instead.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean concession. Casual. Admits opponent's point. Formal: 그것도 맞는 말입니다, 생각해 보니.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'And so' or 'and then.' Casual connective used in storytelling to link events. More spoken than written.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 버스를 놓쳤어. 그래 가지고 택시를 탔는데 택시비가 장난 아니더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I missed the bus. And so I took a taxi, and the fare was no joke.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean connector. Casual/spoken. Links events in story. Formal: 그래서, 그리하여.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'But wait' or 'hold on though.' Used to interject with a new thought, mild objection, or shift in direction.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아니 근데, 그 사람이 왜 거기 있었어? 출장 간다고 하지 않았어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: But wait, why was he there? Didn't he say he was going on a business trip?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean interjection. Casual. Mild objection or new thought. Formal: 그런데, 하지만.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's what I'm saying.' Emphatic agreement, confirming that someone just expressed exactly what you think.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "요즘 물가가 너무 올랐어." "내 말이. 장 보러 갈 때마다 깜짝 놀라."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Prices have gone up so much lately." "That's what I'm saying. I'm shocked every time I go grocery shopping."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean agreement. Casual/intimate. Emphatic validation. Formal: 제 말씀이 바로 그것입니다, 동감입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Of course' or 'obviously.' Emphatic affirmation that something goes without saying.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이번에 도와줄 수 있어?" "당연하지, 말만 해."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Can you help me with this?" "Of course — just say the word."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 당(當 proper) appears in 적당(appropriate), 정당(legitimate). 연(然 so) appears in 자연(nature). Casual. Formal: 당연합니다, 물론입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Tell me about it' or 'who would disagree.' Strong agreement implying the point is so obvious nobody could argue.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이 날씨에 일하러 가기 싫다." "누가 아니래, 나도 집에서 쉬고 싶어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "I don't want to go to work in this weather." "Tell me about it — I want to stay home and rest too."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean rhetorical agreement. Casual. Strong validation. Formal: 모두가 동의합니다, 의심의 여지가 없습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Fair point' or 'acknowledged.' Casual one-word concession validating someone's argument. Popular among younger speakers.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이 드라마 연출이 진짜 좋지 않아?" "인정. 특히 마지막 장면은 소름 돋았어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Isn't the directing in this drama really good?" "Fair point. The last scene especially gave me chills."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 인(認 recognize) appears in 확인(confirmation), 승인(approval). 정(定 settle) appears in 결정(decision). Casual/slang. Formal: 동의합니다, 인정합니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I totally relate.' Expresses deep agreement or shared feeling about a situation or opinion.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "나이 들수록 시간이 빨리 간다는 말, 진짜 맞는 것 같아." "완전 공감. 올해도 벌써 반이 지났잖아."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "The saying that time flies faster as you age seems really true." "I totally relate. Half of this year is already gone."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 완(完 complete) appears in 완성(completion), 완벽(perfection). 전(全 whole) appears in 전부(all). Casual. Formal: 전적으로 동감합니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Right?' Casual contraction of 그렇지, used to seek or express quick agreement in conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "여기 분위기 진짜 좋다, 그치?" "응, 다음에 또 오자."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "The atmosphere here is really great, right?" "Yeah, let's come again next time."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean contraction of 그렇지. Casual/intimate. Seeks agreement. Formal: 그렇지요, 맞지요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Surely not' or 'no way.' Expresses disbelief or reluctance to accept that something could possibly be true.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 설마 걔가 진짜로 회사를 옮긴 거야? 농담인 줄 알았는데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You're not telling me he actually switched companies? I thought it was a joke.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 설(說 say) appears in 학설(theory), 소설(novel). 마(~) together means 'surely not'. Casual/neutral. Formal: 그럴 리 없다, 아마도 아닐 것이다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Not really' or 'I'm not into it.' Mild, casual way to express that something doesn't appeal to you.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이 식당 어때?" "음, 별로인데. 지난번에 왔을 때 맛이 좀 그랬어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "How about this restaurant?" "Hmm, not really. The taste was a bit off last time I came."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 별(別 separate) appears in 특별(special), 구별(distinction). Native 로 ending. Casual. Formal: 그다지 좋지 않습니다, 마음에 들지 않습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I don't think that's right' or 'that seems off.' Softened disagreement used to gently push back on an idea.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "그냥 이대로 제출하면 안 될까?" "그건 좀 아닌 것 같은데, 한 번 더 검토하자."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Can't we just submit it as is?" "I don't think that's a good idea — let's review it one more time."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean softened disagreement. Casual. Gentle pushback. Formal: 적절하지 않은 것 같습니다, 동의하기 어렵습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'What are you talking about?' Dismissive response when someone's statement seems nonsensical or off-base.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "네가 잘못한 거 아니야?" "무슨 소리야, 나는 아무 관련 없어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Wasn't it your fault?" "What are you talking about? I had nothing to do with it."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean dismissal. Casual/confrontational. Rejects nonsensical statement. Formal: 무슨 말씀이십니까, 이해하기 어렵습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm so annoyed' or 'this is irritating.' Direct expression of annoyance at a situation or person.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 인터넷이 또 끊겼어. 진짜 짜증 나, 이번 달에만 벌써 세 번째야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The internet went out again. I'm so annoyed — this is already the third time this month.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 짜증 from 齋(정갈할 재) distorted meaning. Casual/slang. Direct annoyance. Formal: 짜증이 납니다, 화가 납니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Again?' or 'Not this again.' Exasperated reaction when an unwanted situation keeps repeating.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "내일도 야근이래." "또야? 이번 주만 벌써 네 번째잖아."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "They said it's overtime again tomorrow." "Again? That's already the fourth time just this week."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Exasperation at repetition. Formal: 또 그런 일이 일어났습니까, 반복되는군요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm going to lose my mind.' Expresses extreme frustration or the feeling of being pushed past one's limit.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 서류를 세 번이나 다시 쓰라고 해. 환장하겠다, 진짜.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They're making me rewrite the documents for the third time. I'm going to lose my mind, seriously.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 환(換 exchange) appears in 교환(exchange), 전환(conversion). 장(臟 intestines) appears in 오장(five organs). Casual/slang. Formal: 미칠 것 같다, 견디기 힘들다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm completely drained.' Describes being physically or mentally exhausted from a tedious or taxing ordeal.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이사 짐 다 옮기고 나니까 진이 다 빠졌어. 손가락 하나 까딱 못 하겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: After moving all the boxes, I'm completely drained. I can't lift a finger.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 진(津 fluid) appears in 진액(bodily fluids), 침(saliva). Native Korean expression. Casual. Formal: 기력이 소진되다, 지치다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Stop it already' or 'cut it out.' Tells someone to stop doing something repetitive or annoying.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 자꾸 같은 얘기 반복하지 마. 그만 좀 해, 나도 알고 있다고.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Stop repeating the same thing. Cut it out already — I know.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean command. Casual/intimate. Stop annoying behavior. Formal: 그만하십시오, 중단해 주세요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'All I can do is sigh.' Resigned frustration when a situation is so bad there is nothing left to say.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 다음 달 카드값 보고 한숨밖에 안 나왔어. 어디서부터 줄여야 할지 모르겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When I saw next month's credit card bill, all I could do was sigh. I don't know where to start cutting back.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 한숨 means sigh (native Korean). Casual. Resigned frustration. Formal: 한숨만 나옵니다, 답답합니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'There's no end in sight.' Expresses frustration with a task or situation that seems to go on forever.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 보고서 작성 끝이 안 보인다. 쓰면 쓸수록 추가 자료가 필요해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: There's no end in sight with this report. The more I write, the more additional materials I need.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. No end in sight. Formal: 끝을 알 수 없다, 종료 시점이 불명확하다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's a headache' or 'what a pain.' Describes something troublesome and difficult to resolve.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 윗집 소음 문제 때문에 골치 아파. 말해도 안 듣거든.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The noise from the upstairs neighbor is such a headache. They don't listen even when I talk to them.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 골(骨 bone) appears in 뼈(bone), 골격(skeleton). 치(痛 pain) distorted. Casual. Formal: 곤란하다, 어려운 문제다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Whatever happens, happens.' Resigned expression of giving up trying to control a frustrating situation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 더 이상 손 쓸 게 없어. 될 대로 되라, 나는 최선을 다했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: There's nothing more I can do. Whatever happens, happens — I did my best.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean resignation. Casual. Giving up control. Formal: 어떻게 되든 상관없다, 체념한다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Exasperated sigh expressing weariness, annoyance, or mild disgust. Heavier and more drawn-out than a simple 'ah.'
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어휴, 이 더위에 에어컨도 고장이야? 참 되는 일이 하나도 없다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Ugh, the AC is broken in this heat? Nothing is going right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean sigh/exclamation. Casual/universal. Weariness or disgust. More drawn-out than 아. Formal: (no direct formal equivalent - sigh).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'No one else but you could do this.' Strong compliment expressing that someone is uniquely skilled or reliable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이렇게 빨리 해결해 줄 줄은 몰랐어. 역시 너밖에 없다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I didn't expect you to solve it this fast. No one else could've done it but you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 역(亦 also) appears in 역시나(as expected). Native Korean. Casual. Unique praise. Formal: 당신만이 할 수 있습니다, 당신이 최고입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's insane' or 'that's incredible.' Slang expressing strong admiration for something impressive.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 혼자서 이 프로젝트 다 한 거야? 야, 진짜 쩐다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You did this whole project by yourself? Dude, that's incredible.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean slang. Very casual/young. Extreme admiration. Formal: 대단하다, 굉장하다, 놀랍다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's so you.' Compliment acknowledging that someone's action perfectly reflects their best qualities.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 바쁜데도 남 도와주는 거 보니까 역시 너답다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Seeing you help others even when you're busy — that's so you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean suffix -답다 (characteristic). Casual. Compliments authenticity. Formal: 당신다운 행동입니다, 당신의 특성이 잘 드러납니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You've got great sense.' Praises someone's perceptiveness, good taste, or situational awareness.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 선물 고르는 거 진짜 센스 있다. 내가 딱 갖고 싶었던 건데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You've got such great taste in picking gifts. This is exactly what I wanted.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 센스 from English 'sense'. Casual. Praises perceptiveness. Formal: 눈치가 빠르다, 감각이 뛰어나다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You're good at everything.' Admiring exclamation when someone shows unexpected talent in yet another area.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그림도 이렇게 잘 그려? 별걸 다 잘하네, 진짜.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You draw this well too? You're seriously good at everything.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 별(別 special) appears in 특별(special). Native Korean. Casual. Admires versatility. Formal: 다재다능하시네요, 여러 방면에 재능이 있으시네요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I knew you'd pull it off.' Expression of confidence in someone, said after they succeed at something.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 합격한 거 축하해! 네가 해낼 줄 알았어, 한 번도 의심 안 했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Congratulations on passing! I knew you'd pull it off — I never doubted you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Expresses confidence in success. Formal: 성공하실 줄 알았습니다, 예상대로입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You're pretty good at this.' Understated, playful compliment implying someone is actually very skilled.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 당구 처음이라며? 좀 치는데? 완전 거짓말이지.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You said this was your first time playing billiards? You're pretty good — you're totally lying.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 치다 means to play/be skilled (native Korean). Casual/slang. Understated praise. Formal: 실력이 있으시네요, 능숙하시네요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's different when you do it.' Compliment that someone brings a special quality or skill that elevates the result.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 같은 레시피인데 니가 하면 다르다. 훨씬 맛있어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It's the same recipe, but it's different when you make it. It's way more delicious.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/dialect (니가 = 네가). Special quality praise. Formal: 당신이 하시면 특별합니다, 차별화됩니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It'd be a waste to give up now.' Encouragement urging someone to keep going because they have already invested so much.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 여기서 그만두려고? 이만큼 했는데 포기하기엔 아깝다. 조금만 더 힘내 봐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You're going to quit here? After coming this far, it'd be a waste to give up. Push through just a bit more.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 포(抛 throw) appears in 방포(cannon). 기(棄 abandon) appears in 버리다(discard). Casual. Formal: 포기하기에는 아깝습니다, 지속할 가치가 있습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'How did you even come up with that?' Expresses admiration for someone's unexpected creativity or cleverness.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 아이디어 진짜 기발하다. 어떻게 그런 생각을 했어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This idea is really brilliant. How did you even come up with that?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Admires creativity. Formal: 어떻게 그런 발상을 하셨습니까, 창의적이십니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'So, about that...' Transition phrase used to segue from casual talk to the real point or a favor you want to ask.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그래서 말인데, 혹시 이번 주 토요일에 차 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: So about that... could you maybe lend me your car this Saturday?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean transition. Casual. Segues to main point. Formal: 그래서 말씀드리는데, 본론으로 들어가면.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Since we're on the topic' or 'while we're at it.' Brings up something related to the current subject.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 말 나온 김에 하나만 더 얘기할게. 다음 달 회비 인상 건도 논의해야 해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Since we're on the topic, let me bring up one more thing. We need to discuss the fee increase next month.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 김 means occasion/opportunity (native Korean). Casual. Topic connection. Formal: 그 김에, 이 기회에.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'But seriously though.' Shifts to a more earnest or important point within a casual conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 근데 진짜, 너 요즘 살 많이 빠진 것 같아. 무슨 비결이야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: But seriously, you look like you've lost a lot of weight lately. What's your secret?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean intensifier. Casual. Shifts to serious point. Formal: 그런데 정말로, 하지만 사실은.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Setting that aside' or 'that's secondary.' Dismisses one point to redirect attention to something more urgent.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 돈은 그건 둘째 치고, 시간이 부족한 게 더 큰 문제야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Money aside, the bigger problem is that we don't have enough time.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean dismissal. Casual. Sets aside one point. Formal: 그것은 제쳐두고, 그것은 나중 문제이고.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Anyway' or 'in any case.' Wraps up a tangent or debate and refocuses the conversation on the main point.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이유야 어쨌든, 결과적으로 잘 됐으니 됐지 뭐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Whatever the reason, it worked out in the end, so it's fine.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean connector. Casual/neutral. Refocuses conversation. Formal: 어찌 됐든, 어떻든 간에.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'The thing is' or 'what I mean is.' Clarifying preface before explaining a point more precisely.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 하고 싶은 말이 뭐냐면, 이번 기회를 놓치면 안 된다는 거야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: What I'm trying to say is that we can't afford to miss this opportunity.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean clarifier. Casual. Explains more precisely. Formal: 즉, 다시 말하면, 구체적으로 말하자면.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'At any rate' or 'anyway.' Quick conversational wrap-up or pivot, slightly more casual than 어쨌든.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아무튼 결론은 내일까지 끝내야 한다는 거지? 알겠어, 해 볼게.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: At any rate, the bottom line is it needs to be done by tomorrow, right? Got it, I'll try.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean wrapper. Casual. Quick pivot. Formal: 어쨌든, 어떻든 간에.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'The reason I'm bringing this up is...' Polite preface before stating the real purpose of a conversation or call.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 전화한 건 다름이 아니라, 주말에 도움이 좀 필요해서.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The reason I'm calling is that I need some help this weekend.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 다(多 different) appears in 다양(variety), 차이(difference). Polite preface. Formal/polite. More formal: 다름이 아니오라.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'This is off-topic, but...' Signals a pivot to a completely unrelated subject mid-conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 딴 얘기지만, 너 아까 말한 그 책 제목이 뭐였어? 갑자기 생각났어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This is off-topic, but what was the title of that book you mentioned earlier? It just popped into my head.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 딴 means different (native Korean). Casual. Topic shift. Formal: 다른 이야기지만, 화제를 바꾸면.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'So here's the thing.' Introduces a point you have been building up to or hesitating to say.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그게 말이야, 사실 나 다음 달에 이직하려고.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: So here's the thing — actually, I'm planning to change jobs next month.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Introduces built-up point. Formal: 그것이 말입니다, 제가 하고 싶은 말은.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: How impressive (sarcastic — meaning the opposite)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 약속을 또 어겼네? 참 대단하시다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You broke your promise again? How impressive.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 참 means truly (native Korean). 대(大 big) appears in 위대(great). Sarcastic. Opposite meaning. Formal sarcasm: 정말 훌륭하시네요 (tone-dependent).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Sure, you did everything right (dismissive sarcasm)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 남 탓만 하더니, 그래, 네가 다 잘했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You kept blaming others — sure, you did everything right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/sarcastic. Dismissive of claimed competence. Formal: (sarcasm doesn't translate well to formal register).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Oh, you must be suffering so much (ironic sympathy)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 하루 종일 폰만 봤으면서, 아이고 고생이 많으시다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You were on your phone all day, yet oh, you must be suffering so much.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 아이고 is native exclamation. 고(苦 bitter) appears in 고난(hardship). Ironic sympathy. Formal: (sarcasm softens in formal register).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: You have zero social awareness (pointed observation)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 분위기가 이런데 혼자 웃고 있어? 눈치도 없다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The mood is like this and you're laughing alone? Zero social awareness.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 눈치 means social awareness (native Korean). Casual/blunt. Lacks awareness. Formal: 눈치가 없으시네요, 상황 파악을 못하시네요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: All talk, no action
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 매번 하겠다고만 하지, 입만 살았어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You always say you'll do it — you're all talk.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 입 means mouth (native Korean). 살다 means to live. Casual/critical. All talk. Formal: 말만 하고 행동은 안 합니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Is that even something you should say?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 사과한다면서 그게 말이라고 해?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You call that an apology? Is that even something to say?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean rhetorical. Casual/confrontational. Questions appropriateness. Formal: 그것이 말이 됩니까, 적절한 발언입니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: What a show-off (dismissive)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 한 번 맞았다고 잘난 척은.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You got one right and now you're showing off.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/dismissive. Criticizes showing off. 척 means pretense. Formal: 잘난 체를 하시네요, 자랑하시네요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Where did you pick up that bad habit? (rhetorical, mocking)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어른 앞에서 그렇게 말하면, 어디서 배운 거야 그 버릇?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Talking like that in front of elders — where did you pick up that habit?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/sarcastic. Mocks bad habit. Formal: 어디서 그런 습관을 배우셨습니까 (sarcastic tone).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Oh, really? (can be sarcastic or genuinely surprised depending on tone)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 자기가 직접 요리했다고? 오, 진짜?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You cooked it yourself? Oh, really?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Can be sarcastic or genuine. Tone-dependent. Formal: 오, 정말입니까? (tone matters).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: You sure have a way with words (sarcastically implying they only talk)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 변명할 때 보면 하여튼 말은 참 잘해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When it comes to making excuses, you sure have a way with words.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 하(何 what) appears in 하여튼(anyway). Native Korean. Casual/sarcastic. Good talker only. Formal: 어쨌든 말씀은 잘하십니다 (sarcastic).

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Whoa, what is this?! (shock/disbelief)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 헉, 이게 뭐야! 갑자기 사장이 전체 메일을 보냈어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Whoa, what is this?! The boss suddenly sent a company-wide email.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 헉 is native exclamation. Casual. Shock/disbelief. Formal: 어머, 이게 무엇입니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: That gives me chills (shock/awe/creepiness)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 우연의 일치라기엔 소름 끼친다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It gives me chills to call it just a coincidence.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 소름 means goosebumps (native Korean). Casual. Chills from shock/awe. Formal: 오싹합니다, 소름이 돋습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: To be so stunned/appalled one is speechless
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 정도면 기가 차서 말이 안 나온다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: At this point, I'm so stunned I can't even speak.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 기(氣 energy) appears in 기운(energy), 용기(courage). Casual. Stunned speechless. Formal: 어이가 없다, 기가 막힌다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Why out of the blue?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 뜬금없이 왜 전 여자친구 이야기를 꺼내?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Why are you bringing up your ex-girlfriend out of the blue?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 뜬금 means out of the blue (native Korean). Casual. Why suddenly. Formal: 갑자기 왜 그러십니까, 느닷없이.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Everything goes dark before one's eyes (overwhelmed/shocked)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험 결과를 보는 순간 눈앞이 캄캄했다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The moment I saw the test results, everything went dark.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 눈앞 means before eyes (native Korean). 캄캄 is darkness onomatopoeia. Casual. Overwhelmed. Formal: 앞이 막막합니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I thought it wouldn't be the case, but... (surprised it happened)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 설마 했는데, 아닐 줄 알았는데 진짜 합격했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I didn't think it would happen, but I actually passed.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Surprised it happened. Formal: 그렇지 않을 줄 알았는데, 예상 밖입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I had no idea in my wildest dreams
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 사람이 범인이었다니 꿈에도 몰랐다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I had no idea in my wildest dreams that person was the culprit.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 꿈 means dream (native Korean). Casual. Had no idea. Formal: 전혀 몰랐습니다, 상상도 못 했습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I thought my heart was going to stop (extreme shock)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 뒤에서 갑자기 소리 질러서 심장이 멎는 줄 알았다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Someone suddenly screamed from behind — I thought my heart was going to stop.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 심(心 heart) appears in 마음(heart). 장(臟 organ) appears in 간장(liver). Casual. Extreme shock. Formal: 심장이 멎을 뻔했습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Is this for real? (disbelief at something happening)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험 범위가 전부라고? 이게 실화야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The exam covers everything? Is this for real?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 실(實 real) appears in 현실(reality), 사실(fact). 화(話 story) appears in 이야기(story). Casual/slang. Is this real? Formal: 이것이 사실입니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: The sky turned yellow (feeling faint from shock/despair)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 통장 잔고를 확인하고 하늘이 노래졌다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I checked my bank balance and nearly fainted.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 하늘 means sky (native Korean). 노랗다 means yellow. Casual. Feeling faint. Formal: 정신이 아득해지다, 어지럽다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Just think about it one more time (gentle persuasion)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 섣불리 결정하지 말고 한번만 더 생각해 봐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Don't decide hastily — just think about it one more time.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Gentle persuasion. Formal: 한 번 더 생각해 보십시오, 재고해 주십시오.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I understand your position, but... (prelude to disagreeing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 네 입장은 알겠는데, 이건 좀 아닌 것 같아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I understand your position, but I don't think this is right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 입(立 stand) appears in 독립(independence). 장(場 place) appears in 현장(scene). Casual. Understands but disagrees. Formal: 입장은 이해하지만.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Isn't that a different issue? (redirecting an argument)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 비용 문제를 말하는데 왜 감정 이야기를 해? 그건 좀 다른 문제 아니야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: We're talking about costs, so why bring up feelings? Isn't that a different issue?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 문(問 ask) appears in 질문(question). 제(題 topic) appears in 주제(subject). Casual. Redirects argument. Formal: 그것은 다른 문제가 아닙니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: By that logic... (challenging someone's reasoning)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 논리대로라면 아무도 새로운 시도를 못 하겠네.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: By that logic, nobody could ever try anything new.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 논(論 discuss) appears in 토론(debate). 리(理 reason) appears in 이치(principle). Casual/neutral. Challenges reasoning. Formal: 그 논리를 따르면.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: If you think about it carefully / when you really look into it
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 따지고 보면 네가 먼저 약속을 어긴 거잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When you really look into it, you were the one who broke the promise first.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/neutral. Upon careful examination. Formal: 따져 보면, 생각해 보면.

구어체 (Colloquial).korean: 안 그래도 그 얘기 하려고 했는데
구어체 (Colloquial).english: I was actually just about to bring that up
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 안 그래도 그 얘기 하려고 했는데, 네가 먼저 꺼내니까 잘됐다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was just about to bring that up — good thing you mentioned it first.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Was about to bring that up. Formal: 마침 그 이야기를 하려던 참이었습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Don't make excuses
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 바빠서 못 했다니, 핑계 대지 마.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You said you were too busy — don't make excuses.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 핑계 means excuse (native Korean). Casual/confrontational. Don't make excuses. Formal: 핑계를 대지 마십시오, 변명하지 마세요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Are you going to insist until the very end?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 증거가 이렇게 있는데 끝까지 우길 거야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: With this much evidence, are you still going to insist?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 우기다 means to insist stubbornly (native Korean). Casual/confrontational. Will you insist? Formal: 끝까지 우기시겠습니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Even so, is this right? (conceding a point but still disagreeing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 힘들었던 건 알아. 그렇다고 이게 맞아?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I know it was hard. But even so, is this the right thing to do?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Concedes but still disagrees. Formal: 그렇다고 해서 이것이 옳습니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Just you wait / We'll see (mild threat or determination)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 지금은 웃어도 두고 보자, 누가 맞는지.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Laugh now, but just you wait — we'll see who's right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Mild threat/determination. Formal: 지켜보겠습니다, 두고 볼 일입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Hey, did you hear? (starting gossip)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 야, 들었어? 옆 부서 과장이 갑자기 사표 냈대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Hey, did you hear? The manager in the next department suddenly resigned.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 야 is casual attention call (native Korean). Casual/intimate. Gossip starter. Formal: 들으셨습니까, 소식 들으셨어요.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: So what happened? (egging on a story)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 거기까지 알고 끊으면 어떡해, 그래서 어떻게 됐는데?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You can't stop there — so what happened?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Egging on story. Formal: 그래서 어떻게 되었습니까, 결과가 어떻게 되었습니까.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: No but the really funny thing is... (storytelling transition)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아니 근데 진짜 웃긴 게, 다음 날 본인은 아무 일 없다는 듯이 나왔어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: But the really funny thing is, the next day they showed up acting like nothing happened.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual. Storytelling transition. Formal: 그런데 정말 재미있는 것은.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: So they say / Allegedly (hearsay marker)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이번 인사이동에서 팀장이 바뀐다 카더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They say the team leader is changing in the next personnel reshuffle.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean contraction of '~ㄴ다고 하더라'. Casual. Hearsay marker. Formal: ~라고 합니다, ~라는 소문입니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: According to rumors
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 소문에 의하면 그 두 사람이 사귄대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: According to rumors, those two are dating.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 소(消 vanish) appears in 소식(news). 문(聞 hear) appears in 문의(inquiry). Casual/neutral. According to rumors. Formal: 소문으로는.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: That person has always been like that (dismissive characterization)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 놀랄 것도 없어, 그 사람 원래 좀 그래.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Nothing to be surprised about — that person has always been like that.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/dismissive. That person is like that. Formal: 그 사람은 원래 그렇습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: From what I've heard (introducing secondhand info)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 듣자 하니 그쪽 회사 분위기가 완전 엉망이래.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: From what I've heard, the atmosphere at that company is a total mess.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Native Korean. Casual/neutral. From what I heard. Formal: 듣자 하니, 들은 바에 의하면.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: There's a backstory to that
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 걔가 왜 갑자기 그만뒀는지 알아? 그 뒷이야기가 있어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Do you know why they suddenly quit? There's a backstory.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 뒷 means back/behind (native Korean). Casual. There's a backstory. Formal: 그에 대한 뒷이야기가 있습니다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I didn't see it myself, but... (hedging before gossip)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 직접 본 건 아닌데, 그날 사무실에서 큰 소리가 났다고 해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I didn't see it myself, but they say there was a lot of shouting in the office that day.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 직(直 straight) appears in 정직(honesty), 솔직(frankness). 접(接 contact) appears in 접촉(contact). Casual. Hedging before gossip. Formal: 제가 직접 본 것은 아니지만.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I probably shouldn't say this, but... (pretending to hold back before sharing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 함부로 말하면 안 되는데, 그 프로젝트 사실 거의 엎어질 뻔했대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I probably shouldn't say this, but that project almost fell apart.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: 함(함 잡을 함) appears in 포함(include). 부(함부로 only appears together). Casual. Shouldn't say but will. Formal: 함부로 말씀드리면 안 되지만.

고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).english: to infer; to deduce; to reason
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example: 주어진 단서만으로 범인의 동기를 추론하기는 쉽지 않았다.
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example_en: It was not easy to infer the culprit's motive from the given clues alone.
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).notes: To infer; deduce logically. Used in analytical/academic contexts. Related: 유추하다, 분석하다.

고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).english: to see through; to penetrate; to discern the truth of
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example: 그녀는 상대방의 거짓말을 단번에 간파했다.
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example_en: She saw through the other person's lie at once.
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).notes: To see through deception/truth. Related: 꿰뚫다, 파악하다.

고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).english: to deliberate; to ponder deeply; to give careful thought to
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example: 중대한 결정을 앞두고 며칠간 숙고한 끝에 사직서를 냈다.
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example_en: After deliberating for days before a major decision, he submitted his resignation.
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).notes: To deliberate deeply before major decision. More formal than 생각하다. Related: 검토하다, 고민하다.

고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).english: to reflect on; to ruminate; to look back and reconsider
고급 동사 (Advanced Verbs).example: 지난 실패를 반추하며 같은 실수를 되풀이하지 않겠다고 다짐했다.
