고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Prickly/irritable personality. Informal but expressive. Related: 까칠까칠하다, 까칠대다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: demure, gentle and reserved; quietly modest in manner
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그녀는 다소곳한 태도로 인사를 건넸다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: She greeted them in a demure and gentle manner.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Demure; gently reserved. Literary/formal. Related: 조용하다, 순종적이다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: aloof, proudly elegant; carries oneself with cool self-assurance
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그녀는 도도한 분위기를 풍기지만 친해지면 정이 많다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: She gives off an aloof vibe, but she's very affectionate once you get close.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Aloof; proudly elegant. Related: 거만하다, 고고하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: friendly and sociable; pleasant and accommodating in social situations
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 새로 온 동료가 싹싹해서 금방 팀에 녹아들었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The new colleague was so friendly that they quickly blended into the team.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Friendly; sociable and accommodating. Related: 다정하다, 친절하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: dignified, composed; behaving with calm propriety befitting one's status or age
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 아버지는 항상 점잖은 말투로 조언을 해주셨다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: My father always gave advice in a dignified tone.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Dignified; composed propriety. Formal register. Related: 고상하다, 정중하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: petty, cheap; describes behavior that is beneath one's dignity or meanly calculating
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 몇 백 원 가지고 따지다니 너무 치사하지 않아?
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Isn't it too petty to argue over a few hundred won?
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Petty; meanly calculating. Related: 야박하다, 좁은 마음.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: magnanimous, broad-minded; generously forgiving of others' faults
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그분은 실수에 대해 항상 너그럽게 넘어가 주신다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: That person always magnanimously lets mistakes slide.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Magnanimous; generously forgiving. Related: 관대하다, 포용적이다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: stubbornly sincere, doggedly honest; straightforward to the point of seeming simple
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그는 우직한 성격 덕분에 주변 사람들의 신뢰를 얻었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: His stubbornly sincere character earned the trust of those around him.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Stubbornly sincere; straightforward. Related: 성실하다, 직선적이다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: serious and composed; thoughtfully deliberate, not rash
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 중요한 결정일수록 진중한 태도가 필요하다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The more important the decision, the more a composed and deliberate attitude is needed.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Serious/composed; thoughtfully deliberate. Related: 무거운, 심각한.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: cunning, sly; deceptively clever in a manipulative way
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그 정치인은 교활한 수법으로 여론을 자기편으로 돌렸다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The politician used cunning tactics to sway public opinion in his favor.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 교활(狡猾) - 狡(狡 cunning) + 猾(猾 crafty). Cunning, sly, crafty. Negative connotation of cleverness used for selfish ends. Related: 간사하다(奸詐 crafty), 약삭빠르다(shrewd), 영리하다(靈利 clever - neutral).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: dreary, bleak; describes a scene or atmosphere that feels desolately cold and gloomy
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 가을비가 내리니 거리가 을씨년스러워졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: With the autumn rain falling, the streets became dreary and bleak.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. 을씨년 (gloomy year) + 스럽다 (like/seeming). Related: 음산하다(gloomy), 스산하다(bleak), 쓸쓸하다(lonely).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: eerie, gloomy; giving off a dark, unsettling atmosphere
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 안개가 자욱한 산길이 음산한 느낌을 줬다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The fog-shrouded mountain path gave off an eerie feeling.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 음(陰 dark) appears in 그늘(shade), 음지(shade). 산(散 dispersed). Actually 산(森 forest). Related: 을씨년스럽다(dreary), 음울하다(gloomy), 침울하다(depressed).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: warm and harmonious; describes a pleasantly friendly and peaceful atmosphere
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 명절에 온 가족이 모여 화기애애한 분위기 속에서 식사를 했다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: During the holiday, the whole family gathered and ate in a warm, harmonious atmosphere.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 화(和 harmony) appears in 평화(peace), 화목(harmony). 기(氣 energy) appears in 기운(energy), 분위기(atmosphere). 애애(藹藹 warm). Related: 훈훈하다(warm), 화목하다(harmonious).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: desolate, barren; lacking warmth or vitality, emotionally or physically bleak
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 고층 빌딩만 가득한 도심이 삭막하게 느껴졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The downtown area, filled only with high-rises, felt desolate.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 삭(索 desolate) appears in 황삭(desolate). 막(漠 desert) appears in 사막(desert), 광막(vast). Related: 황량하다(desolate), 쓸쓸하다(lonely).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: chaotic, disorderly; describes a scene or situation that is messy and unsettled
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 사건 직후 사무실 분위기가 매우 어수선했다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The office atmosphere was very chaotic right after the incident.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Means disorderly/messy. Related: 혼란스럽다(chaotic), 어지럽다(messy), 산만하다(scattered).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: silent and desolate; an almost oppressive quietness with no signs of life
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 새벽 두 시, 도시 전체가 적막한 정적에 잠겨 있었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: At two in the morning, the entire city was submerged in desolate silence.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 적(寂 quiet) appears in 고적(solitude), 정적(silence). 막(寞 lonely) appears in 쓸쓸함(loneliness). Related: 고요하다(quiet), 쓸쓸하다(lonely).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: chilly and bleak; a cold, forlorn atmosphere that makes one uneasy
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 겨울바람이 불어 폐공장 주변이 스산한 분위기였다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The winter wind blew, creating a chilly, bleak atmosphere around the abandoned factory.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Means bleak/chilly. Related: 쓸쓸하다(lonely), 을씨년스럽다(dreary), 서늘하다(cool).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: unsettling, ominous; describes a tense social atmosphere full of anxiety or rumors
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 연쇄 사건 이후 동네 분위기가 흉흉해졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: After the string of incidents, the neighborhood atmosphere became unsettling.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 흉(兇 ominous) appears in 흉악(ferocious), 불길(ominous). Duplicated for emphasis. Related: 불길하다(ominous), 험악하다(menacing).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: bustling, crowded and noisy; hectic with too many people or things going on
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 명동 거리는 주말마다 관광객으로 번잡하다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Myeongdong streets are bustling with tourists every weekend.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 번(煩 annoying) appears in 귀찮다(troublesome), 번거롭다(bothersome). 잡(雜 miscellaneous) appears in 복잡(complex), 잡다(miscellaneous). Related: 복잡하다(complex), 분주하다(busy).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: heartwarming; also literally warm and cozy, used for feel-good stories or atmospheres
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 낯선 사람이 할머니의 짐을 들어주는 훈훈한 장면이 화제가 됐다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The heartwarming scene of a stranger carrying the elderly woman's bags became a hot topic.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 훈(薰 warm) appears in 훈풍(warm breeze), 온화(warm). Duplicated for emphasis. Related: 화기애애하다(harmonious), 따뜻하다(warm), 포근하다(cozy).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: outstanding, excellent; far surpassing others in ability or quality
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그 연구원은 탁월한 분석력으로 문제의 원인을 짚어냈다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The researcher pinpointed the cause of the problem with outstanding analytical skills.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 탁(卓 outstanding) appears in 탁상(table/outstanding). 월(越 exceed) appears in 초월(transcend), 뛰어넘다(surpass). Related: 뛰어나다(excellent), 출중하다(outstanding).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: insufficient, inadequate; falling short of what is needed or expected
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 이번 대응은 국민의 기대에 미흡했다는 평가를 받았다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: This response was evaluated as falling short of public expectations.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 미(未 not yet) appears in 미완(incomplete), 미비(insufficient). 흡(洽 harmonious) appears in 융흡(harmony), 합흡(agreement). Means inadequate or unsatisfactory.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: distinguished, exceptional; standing out noticeably above the rest
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 출중한 외모와 실력을 겸비한 배우가 주목받고 있다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: An actor who possesses both exceptional looks and skill is drawing attention.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 출(出 exit) appears in 출발(departure), 출신(origin). 중(衆 crowd) appears in 군중(crowd), 대중(public). Related: 뛰어나다(excellent), 탁월하다(outstanding).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: blatant, overt; shamelessly unconcealed, with no attempt to hide intentions
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 상대 팀의 노골적인 시간 끌기에 관중들이 야유를 보냈다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The crowd booed the opposing team's blatant time-wasting.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 노(露 expose) appears in 폭로(exposure), 노출(exposure). 골(骨 bone) appears in 뼈골(bone), 골격(skeleton). Means blatant or explicit.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: incomplete, deficient; lacking necessary elements or preparation
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 법적 장치가 미비하여 피해자 보호가 제대로 이루어지지 않았다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Due to deficient legal safeguards, victim protection was not properly carried out.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 미(未 not yet) appears in 미완(incomplete), 미숙(immature). 비(備 prepare) appears in 준비(preparation), 예비(reserve). Means insufficient or incomplete.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: crude, clumsy; lacking sophistication, especially in schemes or execution
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 치졸한 거짓말은 오히려 신뢰를 무너뜨릴 뿐이다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Crude lies only end up destroying trust.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 치(稚 childish) appears in 유치(childish), 치기(immature). 졸(拙 clumsy) appears in 졸렬(poor), 서졸(clumsy). Means petty or mean.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: vast, enormous in scale; used for data, content, or scope that is immensely large
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 방대한 양의 자료를 분석하는 데 몇 달이 걸렸다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: It took several months to analyze the vast amount of data.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 방(龐 huge) appears in 방대(vastness). 대(大 big) appears in 크다(big), 거대(huge). Related: 거대하다(huge), 광대하다(vast).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: crude, sloppy; poorly made or lacking refinement in quality
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 디자인이 조잡해서 소비자들의 외면을 받았다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The design was so sloppy that consumers turned away from it.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 조(粗 coarse) appears in 조악(crude), 조방(rough). 잡(雜 mixed) appears in 잡다(miscellaneous), 혼잡(crowded). Means crude or shoddy.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: remarkable, conspicuous; noticeably prominent, often used with differences or changes
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 두 집단 간 학업 성취도에 현저한 차이가 나타났다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: A conspicuous difference in academic achievement appeared between the two groups.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 현(顯 reveal) appears in 현재(present), 출현(appearance). 저(著 manifest) appears in 저명(famous), 현저(remarkable). Means remarkable or conspicuous.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: absurd, preposterous; so ridiculous that one is left speechless
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 어처구니없는 실수로 승진 기회를 날려 버렸다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: An absurd mistake cost him his chance at promotion.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Compound meaning absurd or ridiculous. Related: 황당하다, 말도 안 되다, 기가 막히다. Common: 어처구니없는 일.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: sublime, noble; exalted to the highest moral or spiritual level
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 자신을 희생하여 남을 구한 숭고한 행동에 모두 숙연해졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Everyone was humbled by the sublime act of sacrificing oneself to save others.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 숭(崇 revere) appears in 숭배(worship), 존숭(reverence). 고(高 high) appears in 고급(high-class), 최고(highest). Means sublime or lofty.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: profound, deep; intellectually deep and not easily grasped on the surface
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그 철학자의 사상은 심오하여 한 번에 이해하기 어렵다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: That philosopher's ideas are so profound that they are hard to understand at once.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 심(深 deep) appears in 깊심(deep), 심해(deep sea). 오(奧 profound) appears in 오묘(mysterious), 심오(profound). Means profound or deep.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: subtle, mysteriously intricate; delicately complex in a way that defies easy explanation
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 자연의 오묘한 질서 앞에서 인간은 겸허해진다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Before the mysteriously intricate order of nature, humans become humble.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 오(奧 profound) appears in 심오(profound), 오지(remote). 묘(妙 mysterious) appears in 묘책(clever plan), 기묘(strange). Means mysterious or subtle.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: fleeting, transient; passing quickly and leaving nothing behind
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 젊음이 이토록 덧없을 줄은 몰랐다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: I never knew youth could be this fleeting.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Adjective meaning fleeting or transient. Related: 무상하다, 허무하다, 일시적이다. Common: 인생이 덧없다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: impermanent, transient; nothing in the world lasts — a Buddhist-tinged philosophical term
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 인생이 무상하다는 걸 깨달은 후 하루하루에 감사하게 됐다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: After realizing that life is impermanent, I became grateful for each day.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 무(無 nothing) appears in 무용(useless), 무의미(meaningless). 상(常 常) appears in 일상(daily), 항상(always). Means transient or impermanent.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: self-evident, obvious; so clear that no proof or explanation is needed
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 준비 없이 성공할 수 없다는 건 자명한 사실이다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: It is a self-evident fact that one cannot succeed without preparation.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 자(自 self) appears in 자신(oneself), 자동(automatic). 명(明 clear) appears in 명확(clarity), 선명(vivid). Means self-evident or obvious.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: superficial; remaining on the surface without deeper understanding or engagement
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 피상적인 분석으로는 문제의 본질을 파악할 수 없다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: A superficial analysis cannot grasp the essence of the problem.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 피(皮 skin) appears in 피부(skin), 외피(outer skin). 상(相 appearance) appears in 모상(appearance), 상황(situation). Means superficial.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: fundamental, root-level; pertaining to the deepest origin or cause of something
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 사회 불평등의 근원적인 해결책을 모색해야 한다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: We must seek a fundamental solution to social inequality.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 근(根 root) appears in 뿌리근(root), 근본(foundation). 원(源 source) appears in 원천(source), 기원(origin). Means fundamental or primal.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: inevitable, necessary; bound to happen as a logical or natural consequence
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 기술이 발전하면 산업 구조의 변화는 필연적이다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: As technology advances, changes in industrial structure are inevitable.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 필(必 must) appears in 필수(necessity), 반필(must). 연(然 so) appears in 자연(nature), 당연(natural). Means inevitable or necessary.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: ambiguous, vague; unclear in meaning or boundaries, open to multiple interpretations
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 정부의 모호한 입장 때문에 국민들의 혼란이 가중되었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The government's ambiguous stance deepened public confusion.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 모(模 pattern) appears in 모방(imitation), 모형(model). 호(糊 paste/vague) appears in 호리다(blur). Related: 애매하다(ambiguous), 불분명하다(unclear).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: musty, damp and stuffy; having a stale, humid quality that feels unpleasant
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 장마철이라 빨래가 마르지 않고 꿉꿉한 냄새가 난다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The laundry won't dry during the rainy season and gives off a musty smell.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for stuffy or musty. Related: 답답하다, 눅눅하다, 후덥지근하다. Common: 날씨가 꿉꿉하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: thick and stale; a heavy, unpleasant sensation in the mouth or air
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 라면을 먹고 나면 입안이 텁텁해서 물을 많이 마시게 된다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: After eating ramyeon, my mouth feels thick and stale, so I end up drinking a lot of water.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for dry or astringent taste. Related: 깔깔하다, 메마르다, 건조하다. Common: 입이 텁텁하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: sharp and pungent; a biting spiciness or dryness that hits the throat
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 김치찌개가 칼칼해서 속이 다 풀리는 기분이다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The kimchi stew is so sharply spicy that it feels like it clears everything up inside.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for spicy or pungent. Related: 매콤하다, 얼얼하다, 맵다. Common: 맛이 칼칼하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: rough, scratchy; having a coarse texture that irritates when touched
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 새로 산 수건이 까끌까끌해서 피부에 자극이 심하다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The newly bought towel is so scratchy that it really irritates the skin.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for rough texture. Related: 거칠다, 뻣뻣하다, 딱딱하다. Common: 피부가 까끌까끌하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: tingling, numb; a buzzing sensation from spice, cold, or impact
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 마라탕을 먹었더니 입이 얼얼해서 한동안 맛을 못 느꼈다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: After eating mala hotpot, my mouth was so numb that I couldn't taste anything for a while.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for tingling sensation. Related: 따끔하다, 쑤시다, 화끈하다. Common: 입이 얼얼하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: having a raw, fishy smell; the metallic scent of blood or raw seafood
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 시장 골목에 들어서니 생선 비릿한 냄새가 코를 찔렀다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: As I entered the market alley, the raw fishy smell hit my nose.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Adjective meaning fishy or bloody smell. Related: 비린내나다, 냄새나다, 역하다. Common: 생선이 비릿하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: musty, stale; having a stuffy old smell from being closed up too long
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 오래된 창고 문을 여니 퀴퀴한 냄새가 확 풍겼다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: When I opened the old warehouse door, a musty smell instantly wafted out.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for musty smell. Related: 곰팡이냄새나다, 눅눅하다, 꿉꿉하다. Common: 냄새가 퀴퀴하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: greasy, cloying; unpleasantly oily or rich, also used for cheesy or sleazy behavior
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 크림파스타가 너무 느끼해서 반밖에 못 먹었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The cream pasta was so greasy that I could only eat half.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Adjective meaning greasy or rich (for food). Related: 기름지다, 고소하다, 진하다. Common: 음식이 느끼하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: bushy, shaggy; thick and unkempt, typically describing facial hair or overgrown hair
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 수염이 텁수룩하게 자라서 면도를 해야겠다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: My beard has grown bushy and shaggy, so I should shave.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic compound for bushy or shaggy. Related: 덥수룩하다, 수북하다, 무성하다. Common: 수염이 텁수룩하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: sharp tingling; a sudden, electric-like piercing sensation
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 팔꿈치를 부딪히자 팔 전체가 찌릿하게 저려 왔다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: When I bumped my elbow, a sharp tingling sensation ran through my whole arm.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic adjective for tingling or stinging. Related: 찌릿찌릿하다, 얼얼하다, 따끔하다. Common: 전기에 찌릿하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: upright, principled; rigidly honest and refusing to bend to pressure
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 강직한 성격 탓에 상사에게도 잘못된 건 잘못됐다고 말한다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Because of his upright character, he tells even his superiors when something is wrong.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 강(剛 strong) appears in 강건(robust), 강철(steel). 직(直 straight) appears in 정직(honest), 솔직(frank). Means upright or inflexible.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: cowardly, underhanded; lacking courage or resorting to dishonorable means
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 책임을 남에게 떠넘기는 건 비겁한 행동이다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Shifting responsibility onto others is a cowardly act.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 비(卑 low) appears in 비천(lowly), 비하(degradation). 겁(怯 cowardice) appears in 겁나다(scared), 소겁(timid). Means cowardly.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: shameless, lacking decency; having no sense of propriety or embarrassment
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 이렇게 자주 부탁드리기 염치없지만 한 번만 더 도와주세요.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: I know it's shameless to ask so often, but please help me just one more time.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 염(廉 clean) appears in 청염(integrity), 염결(integrity). 치(恥 shame) appears in 수치(shame), 치욕(disgrace). Means shameless.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: noble, lofty; morally pure and elevated in character
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그의 고결한 인격은 주변 사람들에게 깊은 감화를 주었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: His noble character deeply inspired those around him.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 고(高 high) appears in 고급(high-class), 최고(highest). 결(潔 clean) appears in 청결(cleanliness), 결백(innocence). Means noble or lofty.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: despicable, vile; morally low and contemptible in behavior
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 약자를 이용하는 비열한 수법에 분노가 치밀었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Anger surged at the despicable tactics of exploiting the weak.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 비(卑 low) appears in 비천(lowly), 비하(degradation). 열(劣 inferior) appears in 열등(inferior), 악열(vile). Means mean or despicable.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: innocent, guiltless; free from wrongdoing or crime
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그는 끝까지 자신의 결백함을 주장하며 재심을 요청했다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: He maintained his innocence to the end and requested a retrial.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 결(潔 clean) appears in 청결(cleanliness), 고결(noble). 백(白 white) appears in 백색(white), 순백(pure white). Means innocent or pure.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: upright, morally straight; adhering firmly to principles without wavering
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 올곧은 신념을 가진 사람은 어떤 유혹에도 흔들리지 않는다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: A person with upright convictions is not swayed by any temptation.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Adjective meaning upright or straight. Related: 정직하다, 곧다, 바르다. Common: 올곧은 성격.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: treacherous, two-faced; outwardly friendly but harboring deceitful intentions
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 겉으로는 웃으면서 뒤에서 험담하는 간사한 사람을 조심해야 한다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: You have to watch out for treacherous people who smile to your face but gossip behind your back.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 간(奸 wicked) appears in 간악(wicked), 간계(trickery). 사(邪 evil) appears in 사악(evil), 사특(wicked). Related: 교활하다(cunning), 악랄하다(vicious).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: virtuous and generous; warm-hearted with a broad generosity of spirit
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 후덕한 인상 덕분에 처음 만난 사람도 금방 마음을 연다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Thanks to her virtuous and generous demeanor, even people meeting her for the first time quickly open up.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 후(厚 thick) appears in 두후(thick), 농후(dense). 덕(德 virtue) appears in 덕분(thanks to), 미덕(virtue). Means generous or magnanimous.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: brazen, shameless; showing no embarrassment despite wrongdoing
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 잘못을 하고도 사과 한마디 없이 뻔뻔하게 구는 게 이해가 안 된다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: I can't understand how someone can act so brazenly without even a word of apology after doing something wrong.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for shameless. Related: 염치없다, 뻔뻔스럽다, 철면피하다. Common: 뻔뻔한 거짓말.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: exacting, picky; difficult to satisfy or requiring meticulous attention to detail
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 이 교수님은 과제 기준이 까다로워서 학생들이 긴장한다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Students are nervous because this professor's assignment criteria are exacting.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Adjective meaning difficult or picky. Related: 복잡하다, 어렵다, 신경쓰이다. Common: 까다로운 성격.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: abstruse, incomprehensible; so complex and deep that it is extremely hard to understand
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 그 소설은 구조가 난해해서 두 번을 읽고서야 이해했다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The novel's structure was so abstruse that I understood it only after reading it twice.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 난(難 difficult) appears in 곤난(difficulty), 어난(difficult). 해(解 untie) appears in 이해(understanding), 해석(interpretation). Means abstruse or difficult.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: complex and multifaceted; involving many intertwined layers of difficulty
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 한반도의 정세는 복잡다단해서 한마디로 설명할 수 없다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The situation on the Korean Peninsula is complex and multifaceted, impossible to explain in a single sentence.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 복(複 complex) appears in 복합(composite), 중복(duplicate). 잡(雜 mixed) appears in 잡다(miscellaneous), 혼잡(crowded). 다(多 many) appears in 다수(majority), 다양(variety). 단(端 end) appears in 선단(tip), 단서(clue). Means complex and varied.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: easy, smooth; proceeding without much difficulty or effort
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 경험이 있으니 이번에는 한결 수월하게 진행할 수 있었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Since I had experience, I was able to proceed much more smoothly this time.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 수(隨 follow) appears in 수행(practice), 추수(following). 월(越 cross) appears in 초월(transcendence), 월경(crossing). Means easy or smooth.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: easy-looking, not to be underestimated; appears simple but is deceptively challenging
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 상대를 만만하게 봤다가 크게 당한 적이 있다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: I once underestimated my opponent and paid dearly for it.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 만(滿 full) appears in 만족(satisfaction), 충만(fullness). Reduplication suggesting 'easy' or 'not formidable'. Common: 만만한 상대.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: elaborate, exquisite; crafted with meticulous precision and fine detail
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 장인의 손에서 탄생한 정교한 도자기에 감탄이 절로 나왔다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The elaborate ceramics born from the artisan's hands drew spontaneous admiration.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 정(精 refined) appears in 정밀(precise), 정성(sincerity). 교(巧 skillful) appears in 교묘(clever), 기교(technique). Related: 정밀하다(precise), 교묘하다(ingenious).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: trivial, petty; consisting of many small, unimportant details piled up
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 자질구레한 업무에 시간을 빼앗기다 보니 정작 중요한 일을 못 했다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: I spent so much time on trivial tasks that I couldn't get to the actually important work.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Compound meaning trivial or petty. Related: 사소하다, 하찮다, 자잘하다. Common: 자질구레한 일들.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: sloppy, full of holes; lacking thoroughness and easy to find fault with
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 보안이 허술해서 개인정보가 대량으로 유출되었다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Security was so sloppy that personal information was leaked on a massive scale.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 허(虛 empty) appears in 공허(emptiness), 허위(falsehood). 술 is native Korean suffix. Means sloppy or loose.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: tightly woven, dense; with very small gaps, leaving no room for error or escape
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 법망이 촘촘해야 범죄를 사전에 예방할 수 있다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The legal net must be tightly woven to prevent crime in advance.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for dense or closely-packed. Related: 빽빽하다, 조밀하다, 빈틈없다. Common: 촘촘한 간격.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: cumbersome, troublesome; involving tedious and complicated procedures
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 서류 절차가 너무 번거로워서 온라인 신청으로 바꿨으면 좋겠다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: The paperwork process is so cumbersome that I wish they'd switch to online applications.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 번(煩 bother) appears in 번뇌(worry), 귀번(annoying). 거(據 occupy) appears in 점거(occupation), 근거(basis). Means troublesome or cumbersome.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: awkward, stiff; the uncomfortable distance between people who are not yet close
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 오랜만에 만난 친구 사이가 서먹서먹해서 어색한 침묵이 흘렀다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Meeting after a long time, things were awkward between us and an uneasy silence filled the air.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for awkward or distant. Related: 어색하다, 낯설다, 거리감있다. Common: 관계가 서먹서먹하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: estranged, distant; having grown apart in a relationship that was once close
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 한때 절친이었지만 연락을 안 하다 보니 사이가 소원해졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: We were once best friends, but not keeping in touch made us grow distant.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 소(疏 sparse) appears in 소홀(neglect), 희소(rare). 원(遠 far) appears in 원거리(long distance), 멀원(far). Means distant or estranged.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: special, extraordinarily close; a bond that stands out from ordinary relationships
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 할머니와 각별한 사이였기에 그 상실감이 더 컸다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Because I had an extraordinarily close bond with my grandmother, the sense of loss was even greater.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 각(各 each) appears in 각자(each person), 각각(respectively). 별(別 separate) appears in 특별(special), 차별(discrimination). Means special or particular.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: close, solid; describing a strong, reliable relationship built on trust
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 어려운 시기를 함께 겪으면서 두 사람의 우정은 더욱 돈독해졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Going through tough times together made their friendship even stronger and more solid.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 돈(敦 thick) appears in 돈후(generous), 돈후(cordial). 독(篤 sincere) appears in 독실(devout), 독지(devotion). Means cordial or close.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: amicable, smooth; harmonious without friction or conflict
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 부부 사이가 원만하려면 서로의 공간을 존중해야 한다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: For a marriage to be amicable, both sides need to respect each other's space.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 원(圓 round) appears in 원형(circle), 동원(round). 만(滿 full) appears in 만족(satisfaction), 충만(fullness). Means amicable or harmonious.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: cold, indifferent; showing a lack of interest or emotional warmth toward others
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 인사를 건넸는데 냉담한 반응이 돌아와서 당황스러웠다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: I greeted them, but the cold, indifferent response left me flustered.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 냉(冷 cold) appears in 차갑다(cold), 냉정(cold). 담(淡 bland) appears in 담담(calm), 담백(plain). Related: 냉정하다(cold), 무관심하다(indifferent).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: heartless, stingy; lacking generosity or kindness in interpersonal dealings
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 오래 일한 직원에게 아무런 보상도 없이 내보내다니 너무 야박하다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: It's so heartless to let go of a long-serving employee without any compensation.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 야(野 wild) appears in 야생(wild), 야만(barbarous). 박(薄 thin) appears in 박약(weak), 경박(frivolous). Means heartless or stingy.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: tender and sensitive; naturally affectionate and easily moved emotionally
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 다정다감한 성격이라 남의 사정에도 쉽게 눈물을 흘린다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: Being naturally tender and sensitive, she easily sheds tears at others' circumstances.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: 다정다감(多情多感) - 多(多 many) + 情(情 emotion) + 多(多 many) + 感(感 feeling). Warm-hearted, affectionate and sensitive. Deeply empathetic personality. Related: 다정하다(多情 affectionate), 감성적(感性的 emotional).

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: warm, affectionate; showing personal warmth and closeness in a touching way
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 오랫만에 만난 이모가 살갑게 안아주셔서 마음이 따뜻해졌다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: My aunt, whom I hadn't seen in a long time, hugged me warmly, and it warmed my heart.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Adjective meaning friendly or affectionate. Related: 친근하다, 다정하다, 상냥하다. Common: 살갑게 대하다.

고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).english: blunt, curt; not very expressive and seemingly unfriendly in manner
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example: 아버지는 무뚝뚝하지만 행동으로 사랑을 표현하시는 분이다.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).example_en: My father is blunt and curt, but he's someone who expresses love through actions.
고급 형용사 (Advanced Adjectives).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for blunt or gruff. Related: 퉁명스럽다, 냉정하다, 무표정하다. Common: 무뚝뚝한 성격.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: sneakily, stealthily; doing something discreetly so others won't notice
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그는 회의 중에 슬쩍 자리를 빠져나갔다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: He sneaked out of his seat during the meeting.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Sneakily; discreetly so others won't notice. Related: 몰래, 은근히.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: subtly, in a roundabout way; hinting without being direct
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그녀는 넌지시 이직할 생각이 있다고 내비쳤다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: She subtly hinted that she was thinking of changing jobs.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Subtly; hinting without being direct. Related: 에돌려, 한번 말씀해.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: willingly, gladly; with genuine pleasure or readiness
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 도움이 필요하시면 기꺼이 도와드리겠습니다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: If you need help, I will gladly assist you.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Willingly; with genuine pleasure. Related: 흔쾌히, 기쁘게.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: without hesitation, boldly; speaking or acting freely without holding back
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그는 거침없이 자기 의견을 쏟아냈다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: He poured out his opinions without hesitation.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Without hesitation; speaking freely. Related: 활발하게, 마음껏.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: silently, without complaint; enduring or working steadily without a word
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 아버지는 평생 묵묵히 가족을 위해 일하셨다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: My father worked silently for his family his entire life.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Silently; without complaint steadily. Related: 조용히, 말없이.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: calmly, nonchalantly; maintaining composure in a tense or awkward situation
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 거짓말이 들통났는데도 그는 태연히 웃고 있었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Even after his lie was exposed, he was smiling nonchalantly.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Calmly; nonchalantly maintaining composure. Related: 담담하게, 아무렇지 않게.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: unhesitatingly, readily; doing something bold without a moment's pause
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그녀는 서슴없이 수백만 원짜리 기부를 결정했다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: She unhesitatingly decided to donate several million won.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Unhesitatingly; boldly without pause. Related: 거리낌 없이, 과감하게.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: flawlessly, without gaps; thoroughly with no room for error
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 보안팀이 행사장을 빈틈없이 점검했다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: The security team inspected the venue thoroughly without any gaps.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Flawlessly; thoroughly without gaps. Related: 꼼꼼히, 세밀하게.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: entirely, intact; remaining completely as-is without loss or change
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 어머니가 보내주신 반찬이 고스란히 남아 있었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: The side dishes my mother sent remained entirely untouched.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Entirely; intact remaining completely. Related: 온전히, 그대로.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: fumblingly, haltingly; speaking or acting clumsily while searching for the right words or way
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그는 한국어를 더듬더듬 말했지만 의미는 충분히 전달됐다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: He spoke Korean haltingly, but his meaning came across well enough.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Fumblingly; haltingly while searching. Related: 어눌하게, 자꾸자꾸.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: absurdly, ridiculously; to an unreasonable degree, typically describing insufficiency
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 이 프로젝트에 배정된 예산은 턱없이 부족하다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: The budget allocated for this project is absurdly insufficient.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. 턱 (jaw/standard) + 없이 (without). Means unreasonably/absurdly. Related: 터무니없이(absurdly), 엄청나게(extremely), 과도하게(excessively).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: noticeably, considerably; a clear degree of improvement or change
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 운동을 시작하고 나서 몸이 한결 가벼워졌다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: After starting to exercise, my body felt noticeably lighter.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. 한 (one) + 결 (layer). Means consistently/much more. Related: 훨씬(much more), 더욱(more), 일관되게(consistently).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: particularly, uniquely; standing out from the rest in a distinctive way
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 올해는 유독 겨울이 길게 느껴진다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: This year, winter feels particularly long.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 유(唯 only) appears in 유일(only), 오직(only). 독(獨 alone) appears in 독특(unique), 혼자(alone). Related: 특히(especially), 유난히(exceptionally).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: a notch more, even further; indicating a step-up in degree or intensity
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 새 안경을 쓰니 세상이 한층 선명하게 보인다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: With my new glasses, the world looks even clearer.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. 한 (one) + 층 (layer). Means even more/a level higher. Related: 훨씬(much more), 더욱(more), 한결(consistently).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: (not) yet, (not) in time; failing to do something before the moment passes (used with negatives)
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 급하게 나오느라 우산을 미처 챙기지 못했다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: I left in such a hurry that I didn't manage to grab my umbrella in time.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 미(未 not yet) appears in 미래(future), 아직(yet). 처(處 place) appears in 곳(place), 장소(place). Related: 아직(yet), 채(yet), 여태(so far).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: quite, considerably; more than expected (slightly literary tone)
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그의 연설은 자못 진지한 분위기 속에서 이루어졌다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: His speech took place in a quite serious atmosphere.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Means quite/rather/considerably. Related: 제법(quite), 꽤(quite), 상당히(considerably).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: boundlessly, infinitely; to an extreme degree with no limit
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 합격 소식을 듣고 그지없이 기뻤다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: I was boundlessly happy when I heard the news that I passed.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. 그지 (end/limit) + 없이 (without). Means extremely/boundlessly. Related: 더없이(extremely), 지극히(extremely), 한없이(endlessly).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: (cannot) bring oneself to; unable to do something due to moral weight or emotional difficulty
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그 사진을 차마 눈 뜨고 볼 수가 없었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: I couldn't bring myself to look at that photo with my eyes open.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Means cannot bring oneself to. Related: 도저히(by no means), 어찌(how), 감히(dare).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: (not) ordinary, (not) easy; emphasizing that something is no small matter (used with negatives)
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 이번 시험은 여간 어려운 게 아니었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: This exam was no ordinary level of difficult.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Means ordinary/considerable. Used with negatives: 여간 ~이 아니다. Related: 보통(ordinary), 웬만큼(considerably), 제법(quite).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: (not) at all, absolutely (not); complete inability to understand or do something
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 설명을 들어도 도무지 이해가 안 된다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Even after hearing the explanation, I can't understand it at all.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Means by no means/at all. Used with negatives. Related: 전혀(not at all), 결코(never), 도저히(by no means).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: occasionally, from time to time; at irregular but infrequent intervals
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 이따금 고향 친구에게서 연락이 온다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: From time to time, I get a call from a friend back home.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning occasionally or from time to time. Related: 가끔, 때때로, 간간이. Common: 이따금 생각나다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: sometimes, once in a while; occasionally and somewhat randomly
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 아무리 꼼꼼한 사람도 더러 실수를 하기 마련이다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Even the most meticulous person makes mistakes once in a while.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning sometimes or occasionally. Related: 가끔, 이따금, 때때로. Common: 더러 실수하다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: continuously, all along; without interruption from start to present
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 그는 입사한 이후로 줄곧 같은 부서에서 일해 왔다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: He has been working in the same department continuously since he joined the company.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning all along or continuously. Related: 계속, 내내, 쭉. Common: 줄곧 생각하다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: soon after, before long; something happening shortly after a preceding event
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 비가 잠깐 내리더니 이내 그쳤다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: It rained briefly and then stopped before long.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 이(以 with) appears in 이상(more than), 이하(less than). 내(內 inside) appears in 내부(interior), 안내(inside). Used for 'soon' or 'within'.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: earlier, long ago; expressing regret that something should have been done sooner
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 진즉에 말했으면 이렇게까지 안 됐을 텐데.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: If you had said something earlier, it wouldn't have come to this.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 진(眞 true) appears in 진실(truth), 진정(truly). 즉(則 rule) appears in 즉시(immediately), 법즉(law). Used for 'already' or 'long ago'.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: until now, all this time; emphasizing the length of time something has continued
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 여태껏 그 사실을 모르고 있었다니 믿기지 않는다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: I can't believe I didn't know that fact all this time.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Compound meaning until now or all this time. Related: 지금까지, 그동안, 여태까지. Common: 여태껏 몰랐다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: suddenly, out of the blue; a thought or feeling arising unexpectedly
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 길을 걷다가 문득 어릴 적 기억이 떠올랐다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: While walking down the street, a childhood memory suddenly came to mind.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning suddenly or all of a sudden. Related: 갑자기, 홀연히, 불현듯. Common: 문득 생각나다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: here and there, at intervals; sporadically with gaps in between
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 흐린 하늘 사이로 간간이 햇살이 비쳤다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Sunlight peeked through the cloudy sky here and there.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Reduplication of 간 (interval). Related: 이따금, 가끔, 드문드문. Common: 간간이 비가 오다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: rather late, toward the late end; at a somewhat delayed time
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 주말이라 느지막이 일어나서 브런치를 먹었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Since it was the weekend, I got up rather late and had brunch.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic adverb meaning fairly late. Related: 늦게, 조금 늦게, 늦은 시간에. Common: 느지막이 도착하다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: after a while, presently; following a pause or passage of time (literary/narrative tone)
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 긴 침묵이 흐른 뒤 이윽고 그가 입을 열었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: After a long silence, he finally opened his mouth.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning after a while or soon after. Related: 얼마 후, 곧, 잠시 후. Common: 이윽고 도착하다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: insistently, going out of one's way; doing something unnecessary or despite it being inadvisable
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 안 해도 될 일을 굳이 왜 하려고 해?
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Why are you insisting on doing something you don't even need to do?
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning insistently or necessarily. Related: 반드시, 꼭, 일부러. Common: 굳이 할 필요 없다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: anyway, in any case; the outcome remains the same regardless
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 어차피 늦은 거 서두를 필요 없어.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: We're late anyway, so there's no need to rush.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 어(於 at) appears in 어디(where), 어느(which). 차(此 this) appears in 이차(this time), 차례(order). 피 is native suffix. Means 'anyway' or 'in any case'.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: let alone, much less; if even the easier case is difficult, the harder one goes without saying
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 어른도 힘든 일인데 하물며 아이가 할 수 있겠어?
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: It's hard even for adults, let alone a child -- how could they manage?
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 하(何 what) appears in 하나(one), 어하(what). 물(物 thing) appears in 사물(object), 동물(animal). 며 is conjunctive. Means 'let alone' or 'much less'.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: when it actually comes down to it; contrasting preparation or talk with the actual moment
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 평소에는 할 말이 많더니 정작 발표할 때는 아무 말도 못 했다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: He usually had a lot to say, but when it actually came time to present, he couldn't say a word.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 정(正 correct) appears in 정확(precise), 공정(fair). 작(作 make) appears in 작품(work), 제작(production). Used for 'actually' or 'in fact'.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: from the very beginning, in the first place; the root cause or starting point of a situation
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 애당초 계획 자체가 무리였다는 걸 이제야 깨달았다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: I only now realize that the plan itself was unreasonable from the very beginning.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 애(哀 sorrow) appears in 애처롭다(pitiful), 슬애(sorrow). 당(當 appropriate) appears in 당연(natural), 적당(appropriate). 초(初 begin) appears in 초기(early), 최초(first). Means 'from the beginning'.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: for no reason, without cause; feeling or doing something without a clear basis
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 오랜만에 그 노래를 들으니 괜스레 눈물이 났다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: Hearing that song after a long time, tears came for no particular reason.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning for no reason or needlessly. Related: 괜히, 쓸데없이, 공연히. Common: 괜스레 걱정하다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: customarily, as a matter of course; something expected or habitual

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Adverb meaning habitually or naturally. Related: 당연히, 늘, 자연히. Common: 으레 그렇다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: at all costs, by all means; a strong resolve to accomplish something no matter what

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 기(期 period) appears in 기대(expectation), 시기(time). 필(必 必 필 필 必 必 必 必 必 必 必 必 必 必필 必 必 必 必 必 必 必필필 必 必 必必必필 必필 必필필 必필 必필 必必필 必必필필 必必필必필 必필필必필필必필必必필필必必필필필필필필필필필필필필필필필필필필필must) appears in 필수(necessity), 필요(necessity). 코 (emphatic). Related: 반드시(surely), 꼭(surely).

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: for no good reason, needlessly; doing something pointless that only causes trouble

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: 공(空 empty) appears in 공허(emptiness), 공백(blank). 연(然 so) appears in 자연(nature), 당연(natural). Used for needlessly or for no reason.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: almost, nearly; narrowly avoiding a negative outcome (always implies relief)

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: streaming down, pouring; the sound and sight of rain falling heavily in sheets
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 하늘이 갑자기 어두워지더니 비가 주룩주룩 쏟아지기 시작했다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: The sky suddenly darkened and rain began pouring down in sheets.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: stealthily, on tiptoe; moving quietly so as not to be noticed
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 아이가 살금살금 부엌에 들어가서 과자를 꺼내 먹었다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: The child tiptoed into the kitchen and snuck some cookies.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic reduplication for stealthily. Related: 살살, 조용히, 몰래. Common: 살금살금 다가가다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: with a sudden surge of emotion; choking up unexpectedly
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example: 졸업식에서 은사님 얼굴을 보자마자 울컥 눈물이 쏟아졌다.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).example_en: The moment I saw my mentor's face at graduation, tears suddenly welled up.
고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).notes: Native Korean. Mimetic adverb for sudden surge of emotion. Related: 갑자기, 북받쳐, 확. Common: 울컥 화가 나다.

고급 부사 (Advanced Adverbs).english: in a fluster, frantically; rushing around in a panicked, disorderly way
